Reviews.Content: It is  so so so good product. We can see the baby either at night or day. Very clear picture!

Reviews.Title: Good seller but had to return it :(
Reviews.Author: LittleDitty
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera monitor because I babysit with my grandbaby often and I feel better if I can check in on her while she is sleeping. I needed a wireless monitor so I can move from room to room. Unfortunately, it didn't come with the battery for the remote monitor so I would have keep it plugged in to the wall to be able to use it. The company nor I could find a replacement battery. The description says uses AA batteries but it doesn't. It only takes some kind of battery pack like for a cell phone or cordless phone. I used it once, it worked GREAT but every time I needed to go another room, I would have to unplug it and move it. If I could get a battery for this I would totally love it! I will continue to look for one. But the seller was great. They returned my emails quickly and they are making it very easy to return the item. I am in the process of returning it right now and they will return my $.

Reviews.Title: Levana Babyview20 Monitor 2pk
Reviews.Author: Jackie Bayne
Reviews.Content: My mother ordered these for me when I had my last baby, when I needed to monitor more than one room! Once you are able to see your child and monitor them you do not want to go back to just listening!  We had some static and pictures loss problems with the monitors and did have to mail them back to be worked on - it was hard to be without them! We then received the wrong ones back! But, ShopTronics did come through and provided us with new ones! So though it took a little while we are now very happy and ShopTronices ensured that we the customer were satisfied in the end.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it.  Poorly made.
Reviews.Author: Manuel R Herrera
Reviews.Content: I was considering buying the Summer Infant Monitor and bought this one instead because it had great reviews.  I've had it for 2 months and the monitor screen already broke (it doesn't show any image, only sound).  I haven't dropped it or anything, so I guess the quality is just terrible.  It's made cheap, very light-weight plastic.  Before this I had an older version of the Summer Infant monitor and it lasted almost 2 years.

Reviews.Title: First Time using one
Reviews.Author: Princess Sara
Reviews.Content: It's the first time we buy a wireless baby monitor. We searched everywhere for one that included both the monitor and camera for a reasonable price and we did here with Amazon. For the first few weeks since we've received it we havent had any problems, so I do recommend it. It serves its purpose well.

Reviews.Title: The "Third" Eye
Reviews.Author: Bob Richards
Reviews.Content: The Babyview 20 also does will, in keeping track of a +90 year old senior, who, on occasion, takes a "midnight stroll". I have been able to control the strolls, since my purchase of this monitor. The clarity of the image, as well as the wireless feature, has done wonders for my "peace of mind". I highly recommend the BAYBYVIEW 20 in this kind of application. Sincerely, Bob Richards

Reviews.Title: Great babyview
Reviews.Author: Ruileal
Reviews.Content: The device is beautifully finished in a great quality! the image resolution is very cool and magnetic base makes perfect differential. The night the quality is very good even with zero lighting.

Reviews.Title: Very good Monitor!
Reviews.Author: Maria C. Martinez "jazielatina"
Reviews.Content: I must say after reading some of these reviews I am baffled. This monitor does everything as advertised and I am very impressed with the quality. Like any other video monitor of comparable pricing there are minor delays in video but my a couple of secs. at most. The monitor pics up sounds of the baby while eliminating extra background noise which is great. I hear every little sound my son makes not just when he cries as a previous review stated. My only issue is the the screen of the receiver is very small and if the reciever picture was a bit bigger it would certainly be much better. I love the soft night light and although I have yet to use it for my newborn the music is very soft and it will probably come in handy in the near future when I will allow my baby to begin self soothing. Overall a great product and the price was right. I do recommend it for anyone who can't quite afford the procier models but want to have a reliable video monitor for their baby.

Reviews.Title: Reliable baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Angela
Reviews.Content: We bought this to monitor our now 22 month old, and have loved it the entire time. I very recently have a newfound passion for this monitor because we are expecting baby #2 and we bought a Lorex LW 2451 to test out monitoring two rooms via two cameras in one monitor, and we were just horrified by the allegedly superior Lorex, and it made us appreciate this simple Levana even more. Overall, this is just a very sturdy, very consistent, very reliable monitor that transmits very well.Pros:- Monitors and transmits ALL OF THE SOUND in the room. This is CRITICAL to us. Fancier monitors like the Lorex LW2451 do this weird thing where they equalize to the background level of sound, set that to be "quiet" and then only transmit sound that is louder than that background. This was HIGHLY problematic for us because we use a white noise machine in the baby's room, and the Lorex wouldn't transmit the baby's cries unless she was crying louder than the white noise machine, which meant she was crying for a minute before it transmitted. This DOES NOT happen with the Levana - the Levana transmits it all. So, I hear the constant whoosh of the white noise, AND I hear every little peep my baby makes. So, I'd give this a "win" for sensitivity.- Display is quite clear enough to determine if your baby needs your intervention.- Battery life is great - we just plug it in overnight, but we keep it unplugged for naptime monitoring.- Lullabyes are cute. We used to use this sometimes when she was littler. Didn't end up using it too much, but they work.- Excellent range. We live in a 2100 sq ft upstairs/downstairs house and have not had signal problems despite there being about 4 or 5 thick walls in between her room and our living room. Also does not interfere with WiFi in our experience.- Comes with a very nice clamp attachment, so we keep it clamped up high on a lamp pole... no need to wall-mount.Cons:- No way to communicate with the baby. This isn't a big deal to me, but initially I thought it'd be nice to let her know we're on our way to get her.- No way to completely turn off monitor while leaving sound on. We can't use the Vox feature (the Vox feature only turns on the monitor video/audio when it hears a sound) because we use a white noise machine, so there's always sound transmitting. It'd be nice to blank the display and leave audio on at night so our room wasn't illuminated, but I find the display goes dark enough so long as there's not an object immediately in front of it (closer than the baby).

Reviews.Title: useless for newborn
Reviews.Author: busy academic "busy academic"
Reviews.Content: The camera and display are too small and the resolution not high enough to actually see whether my newborn is crying or just making grunting sounds.  All I can see is that she's in her bassinet and I don't need a camera for that.  Maybe a more expensive one will meet my needs

Reviews.Title: A gift
Reviews.Author: Lora F.
Reviews.Content: This was a gift and the new parents loved it. They said it was easy to set up and use.

Reviews.Title: Best of the rest
Reviews.Author: Deb Peterson
Reviews.Content: We read reviews of several video monitors before choosing the BabyView 20 to purchase for my daughter's new baby. She loves it.! Picture on the monitor is clear and we like the small, compact camers and monitor. Several of the complaints we read on this particular unit were that it picked up neighbors' WiFi and cell phones. We have not any any problems like that at all and our house is just 15 feet from the neighbors on both sides. We've even tested the monitor outdoors in the back yard and it still works perfectly. My daughter really loves the lullabies and being able to activate them from downstairs to where the baby's nursery is upstairs. She also appreciates it having a night light. Overall, she is very pleased with the monitor.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Carly
Reviews.Content: The video monitor is great to have. It's easy to use and as small as other monitors so it travels well.

Reviews.Title: Very Handy Device
Reviews.Author: DEH
Reviews.Content: I chose this rating because the product is a very good value for the price. The features surpass most of the other monitors. I would highly recommend the levant BABYVIEW20.

Reviews.Title: As expected, only easier.
Reviews.Author: Victoria T
Reviews.Content: We found the monitor to be very quick to set up and easy to use. And, it looks great in our nursery.  We especially like the ability to remotely turn on the lullabies!

Reviews.Title: BabyView 20: Not durable
Reviews.Author: GM94117
Reviews.Content: Around the 9-10 month mark, the handheld receiver stopped working unexpectedly.  Customer service was not helpful in that they wanted to have a proof of purchase (which we didn't have since it was a gift) showing it was less than one year old. I offered them the serial number so they could check that way but they refused. They offered to send me a new receiver for $80.  Since there was no point in spending $80 to get a new handheld (and to run the risk it would break again, we threw the Babyview away.)  We will not buy anything from Levana again.

Reviews.Title: Good product for the price
Reviews.Author: Elena L.
Reviews.Content: We bought this product about a month ago to use in our baby boy room. So far we are happy with the product. It was very easy to set up. The sound and image qualities are great. The only thing we wish this unit can do is zoom in so we can see the baby closer.

Reviews.Title: Could be better...
Reviews.Author: CTS "cts"
Reviews.Content: It has been a while since I received this monitor-I got it as a shower gift when pregnant with my daughter-now just over 2 years ago.  It has held up well in the past 2 years, so for longevity's sake, I would definitely recommend it.  However, I do have a few issues with it.  To be fair, this is the only monitor we have ever owned, so some of the comments may be flaws with all monitors. I am grateful it has lasted this long...1. First, when my daughter was born, we used the clip attachment to hold the camera on the rail of her crib.  However, it seemed we could never get it tight enough, and the camera would swivel around, blocking our view.  This is in part due to the clip attachment (much like a vice grip), as well as the huge power adapter which weighed too much to keep the camera in one location.2. The two options for picking up sound are the continous feed and the intermittent.  With the continous feed, I can hear a high pitched whine at all times when the monitor is on.  With the intermittent setting, the monitor screen is activated by sound.  When the monitor activates, it makes a loud popping noise.  Both are distracting; it depends on whether you want constant distraction or a rude awakening when this thing pops at night.3. There are a series of 3 songs that can be activated to play from the monitor handset. You can choose to play one song on a continuous loop, or all songs on a loop. The music is rather soothing, and the songs are common ones.  However, you have to also turn the music off from the monitor handset.  If you go into baby's room, and want to turn the music off, you have to turn the whole camera off to stop the music. Also, if you turn the music on while in the continuous monitoring mode, then decide to change to intermittent, the music stops.4. I am one of those people that leaves the AC adapter plugged ito the monitor handset at all times, so I have drained the battery to the point that it won't hold a charge for more than 5 minutes.  Too bad if I want to take the handset with me to another room; I have to unplug it and take the whole thing. Incidentally, when the battery is getting low, the little light on the front starts blinking, and the monitor hums/whines very loudly.  It is hard to miss.5. The picture quality is not that great, especially at night (looks rather grainy). Other reviewers have said that the screen freezes, but I have only noted it to "flash" very quickly and regularly.6. There is a night light on the camera, but it cannot be activated remotely.  It is a series of little orange stars.  It doesn't put off a whole lot of light.

Reviews.Title: IMPRESSED
Reviews.Author: SAM
Reviews.Content: This product is amazing I totally love it and use it every single day. I have no problems with it. the view is good and it is very strong since it still works after surviving a few falls from me. This is a big help especially when getting things done. No complaints

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: The camera does not work.  No matter how many times I synced it I only got audio.  I even placed the camera next to the receiver and still I could not get any video.

Reviews.Title: Monitor only 6 months old and has virtually no video
Reviews.Author: Josh's Mom "Josh's Mom"
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd Levana BabyView.  The first basically died almost 2 years in and worked pretty well although the plugs became worn and wouldn't stay plugged in the end.  We even had it warrantied to try to fix it.  So we scrapped that one and got a new one.  The video has been a problem since day 1 with night vision not working well.  Now it doesn't work at all and it's only 6 months old.  I'm in a nightmare warranty situation with CDW trying to get a new monitor.  They want to troubleshoot this one for 6 weeks and then tell me what's going on.  I think if it's under warranty and doesn't work I should be able to get a new one.  They'll do that, but you have to pay the full retail rate of the monitor first and then if they can't fix it they'll refund you.  If they can fix it, I don't know what you do.  Either way, you can't talk to anyone on the phone and they drive you to email to work out issues.  It always takes a day for someone to answer you so that's taken two weeks of back and forth.  To pay for the replacement monitor, they asked me to send my credit card info via email.  I refused and they said I could call, but gave no call in number.  They repeatedly asked for the same info every time - proof of purchase and the UPC from the box which I have.  All feels like trying to put me off.  Now they've closed my warranty claim with no resolution.  ARGH.  So I say bad product with a half life and even worse support.

Reviews.Title: Great... if you don't have wireless
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: This monitor is great, if you don't have wireless. If you do have wireless, then expect to hear the monitor turn on and off. When I wrote to the company, they seemed to imply that it was normal for the wireless signal to interfere. Now, we're shopping for a new monitor. The video is nice, except when the little one moves around in her crib and wedges herself into the corner.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: J. Allen
Reviews.Content: This monitor has a great picture. The picture and sound do cut out sometimes, but it's only for a few second at a time when it happens. We had issues with the initial battery going dead after only 10 minutes of being off the charger, but we got a new one from Levana. Getting the battery was time consuming as we were transferred to several different people before we could get any resolution.Overall, this is a good monitor, and the picture is the best I've seen.

Reviews.Title: Nothing fancy, works great
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I ended up purchasing this monitor after a friend recommended it. I think it works great, the screen is big enough to see what is going on, I don't need a full HD picture of my kid as they sleep, I just need to know that they are sleeping. The camera is small and fits well in a corner of the crib and can be angled to know what is happening. Easy to put together and work. I live in a smaller condo so the sound is irrelevant but it seems to work as well.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Euro_gurl
Reviews.Content: We couldn't be happier. it takes a while for the sound to kick in, but when she starts really crying it kicks in.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality Video Monitor
Reviews.Author: clk112
Reviews.Content: I received this monitor as a baby shower gift.  It worked fine for about 3 or 4 months until the screen began to sporadically freeze on me.  It would require me to turn the monitor off and then back on to unfreeze it.  It became very alarming and annoying, to say the very least, because the monitor would show my baby "sleeping" when, in fact, the screen had froze and she was actually awake.  This would happen every two or three weeks.  The monitor then began to make a loud clicking sound every time I would turn it on.  And alas, after turning the monitor off and on to unfreeze the screen today, the monitor made a loud POP and the entire screen went blank.  The video function no longer works--all I see now is a white screen.  Although the VOX seems to still work, it barely catches any sound in the nursery (which is why I never relied on the VOX function, just the video) so the entire monitor has become useless.  As one reviewer put it, if you need a monitor in which you don't need to see or hear your baby, then this is the one for you.  Conclusion:  this monitor is of very POOR QUALITY and I would never recommend it to anyone.  Although I did not personally purchase this for myself, I will steer clear of any Levana products in the future.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: rafael xavier
Reviews.Content: This product is amazing and the quality of image is superb even in the dark. We can see our baby without interference inside our house (15 ft at least) and we can activate music for her on the monitor cam as a remote control. We loved!

Reviews.Title: Best baby monitor
Reviews.Author: denise d. g. santos "Dsantos"
Reviews.Content: This is the best baby monitor I had. I tried 3 other brands before this one. It is the only one that works inside my apartment without interference.

Reviews.Title: terrible life cycle
Reviews.Author: Same Same
Reviews.Content: Battery went dead after two months.Support just sucks! two days waiting time to get a respond.$30 to get a replacement battery.I ended up buying a different monitor

Reviews.Title: Levana BABYVIEW20 Interference-Free Digital Wireless Video Baby Monitor with Night Light Lullaby Camera
Reviews.Author: db0515
Reviews.Content: The Monitor works great! The night vision is pretty clear as well, I can see my daughter just find. I LOVE the "VOX" feature. I am one person that has trouble sleeping with lights on in the room. With the "VOX" feature the monitor screen shuts off but at any new sounds it lights up and you can hear it just fine.The ONLY issue I have had is that when the monitor is in use and I am on my laptop, I cannot connect to the internet and that once again, is only on my laptop. If I sit in a room closer to my daughters, I do not get kicked off the internet. The signal affects no other computer or internet on those computers.I just wish I would have bought this when my daughter was a new born. Great Buy! You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Bad quality
Reviews.Author: Jacek Nowicki
Reviews.Content: 1) After a few days the screen started missing part of displaying area line by line; after a week like 10% of the screen was showing nothing2) The magnetic stand is actually useless and more likely causing problems; You need to put that camera the way to see your baby from a higher point of view; the magnetic stand is not strong enough and the camera is moving freely; basically I had to glue it to the stand3) The quality of the picture itself is lower then average.4) Finally screen stopped working; I passed my return policy 7 days ago; will throw that to garbage and need to buy something better from Babys"R"us - this time with coverage plan and for sure no Levana;Low price - you are getting what you paid for;

Reviews.Title: Fine monitor but VOX feature doesn't work
Reviews.Author: csiegs
Reviews.Content: We've been using this monitor for about 9 months, and we haven't had any problems with a freezing picture.  Video quality is good - clear picture, color if there's light in the room, B&W; if the lights are off (as expected due to IR technology).  Our one complaint is the VOX feature.  Other reviewers said their units weren't sensitive enough, but ours is the opposite - it's WAY too sensitive.  If we activate VOX, the screen shuts off after 30 seconds, but then *immediately* turns back on.  But I'm 10 feet down the hall in the living room reading a book, and the house is completely quiet - no stereos, no televisions, no cats meowing, no cars driving by.  There isn't even a fan on in the baby's room.  I don't know what is activating the VOX, but it has never worked properly, despite my repeated attempts.  So basically, if we want to save the battery on the video monitor, we have to use a 2nd audio-only monitor.  When we hear noise on the 2nd monitor, we turn on the video to see what the situation is.  What a pain!

Reviews.Title: Great, with a few minor issues
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: We purchased this baby monitor 2.5 years ago after researching many different monitors.  For the price, we have been very happy.  Here are some of the pros and cons from our experience.Pros:* The price.  For a video baby monitor, this asking price is pretty good.* Durability. We have carried the monitor around all over the house and put it through its paces.  So far, after 2.5 years, the monitor has held up and continues to work.  The camera itself has taken a few falls off the top of a dresser onto carpeted floor without any issues.* Range.  We have been able to receive a link signal to the camera from everywhere without our house (3200 sq ft).  This was pleasant surprise for me.  It includes having the camera in an upstairs bedroom and the monitor in a finished basement.  Still works great.* Vox.  The vox mode worked pretty well for us.  It was not too sensitive for needs most of the time.  Occasionally the fan would trigger the vox in the right conditions, but this is not a problem 90% of the time.* Volume. The monitor can be turned up very loud.  It's great for if you want to leave it in a room and do some other stuff in another room and still hear it.  We normally have it at just 1/4 volume, and it's great.Cons:* Video quality.  I'm not sure if this is due to the screen or the camera, but the colors are very washed out.  For the price, I didn't expect much as far as video quality goes.  It still gets the job done to get a quick peek at your child while you are out of the room.* Battery life.  The battery has degraded over the last couple of years and does not last very long now.  We have not yet looked into buying a replacement battery, so unfortunately, I can not comment on what that would cost.  This hasn't been a big deal for us as usually the monitor stays plugged in by our bed.* Night light feature bug.  There seems to be a bug with the system where every once in a while, the stars that light up on the camera will turn on without you pressing the button on the monitor.  They are not terribly bright, so it's not a big deal, but it could be an issue for some people.  Perhaps its interference from other wireless signals or something.  We haven't been able to pinpoint the problem.* Wireless interference.  We initially hit some bad interference with our wireless internet router in our house with this monitor.  After some channel switching, I was able to resolve the issue, but it was a pain for a while.  If you have a 2.4GHz wireless router, be aware that you may have some issue with wireless speed while the monitor is active.Overall, I would say that we are happy with this purchase.  I'm giving the monitor 4 stars due to just a few issues and it not being perfect.  I would definitely buy this monitor again!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: cobralee
Reviews.Content: This is the third Levana Babyview20 I purchased...2 for my grandkids and this third one for my mother who is elderly....great experience with all 3, no problems and no outside interference just as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Happy with my purchase!
Reviews.Author: PJ Skidoo
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I got this version of the model and not the newer model based a review I read.  We bought this as a baby shower gift for my brother and his wife for their future child.  I was eager to see how it worked, so I tested it out for him today.  The quality of the picture is a lot better than I expected, especially for a baby monitor.  In "day" and "night" vision, the picture was still clear.  Someone waved their hand in front of the camera quickly and the response time on the video monitor was pretty current.  It didn't appear to have any delay!  I only rated this a 4 only because I forgot to take the monitor throughout the house to see how well it worked.  The sound came in clear too.  Great monitor for the price!  Let's hope it lasts a long time!

Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL BABY MONITOR!!
Reviews.Author: Kelly Winslett
Reviews.Content: I received this monitor as a gift when my 3rd baby was born early 2010.  Have been using it ever since.  What I like is the way it only has sound if it is more than a quick noise.  No more interruptions for a cough or a sigh.  I also love the night vision feature.

Reviews.Title: Started off "Surprisingly Pleased" now "in the market for a new monitor"
Reviews.Author: Meghan M Jenkins
Reviews.Content: When we first started using this monitor with our newborn i wasnt really sold on it and even looked around for a replacement. But we had spent almost 200$ on it from Babies r us so decided to give it more time. My early complaints were that every time my son moved or a loud car drove through or neighborhood it would activate the VOX and as mentioned in other reviews it has an audible loud click when the video turns on. For a sleep deprived mom with a new born that "click" waking me up out of a dead sleep was unwelcomed. Also the music "on" switch is very easy to accidently hit and since there is no volume control to this music which i find too loud i was always scared to death of accidently hitting it so i nver carried the monitor around with me. The one time i did clip it to my waist to do dishes, i accidently hit the music button so i learned this quick.However, 10 months later, i love this monitor. The battery lasts easy 10 hours. sometimes i forget to plug it in before bed and it will go all night on battery. When my son started rolling over onto his stomach every time i put him down at 2 months old i was typical new mom terrified of him getting stuck on his belly and dying of SIDs (thanks "back is best" campaign.) having the video was piece of mind. Even though it isnt high- def i could actually see his back moving up and down as he breathed. I came to appreciate the "click" when he got older and i wanted to let him cry it out and learn to self soothe but it was REALLY hard to listen to him cry. So id turn the audio all the way down and just listen for a "click" when he was asleep or awake. Now that he likes to talk himself to sleep it is also nice. I saved the best for last- I COULD NOT LIVE WITHOUT THAT STUPID MUSIC PLAYER! my son loves it!! even the monitor is one of his favorite toys because he can listen to music from it player through the speaker and watch the lights. When he is sick or just having difficulty settling down or i just need to buy a few extra minutes with him in his crib in the morning or post-nap all i have to do is "twinkle twinkle him" and he just lays there sucking his thumb and staring up at the light on the camera. so glad i did not replace this before giving it a chance. seeing it for so cheap on amazon it is a must have if you are concidering a video monitor.We had to mount it to the wall out if his reach. Wish it had a wall mount but we made do.Update: 4/8/12 after 13 months of use-Unit has stopped working in a functional way. Started a couple weeks ago with the VOX just staying on all the time. Then the sound would not cut on at the handheld device. Now you turn it on and it just freeze frames randomly. so it looks like my kid is sound asleep but i am hearing thumping noise from upstairs which can only be my son. Turning it on an off unfreezes it but really is now worthless.

Reviews.Title: Awesome monitor that has great range and durability
Reviews.Author: phejos
Reviews.Content: We've used our monitor for close to a year now and found that it's been great throughout.  flexible enough to place most anywhere and a clear enough picture to see our child in the dark (a bit odd at first, but you get used to it).  Highly recommend!  Great for the cost.  You'll use it well past the 1st year.

Reviews.Title: Great.....for a while (we purchased twice and same problem)
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: I first bought this monitor for use with our daughter who was born in jan 2010. He worked very well for the first year. The picture isn't as clear and crisp as I would like, but could tell if our daughter was awake, asleep, laying down, standing up, etc.  The night vision quality wasn't the greatest, our daughter just looked like a blob on the screen. The quality of the image didn't really concern me since all I really cared about was if she was just crying out during her sleep or actually sitting/standing in her crib. I replaced the first monitor after about a year because the screen would freeze. I would think she was sleeping soundly and not moving, only to discover she is screaming bloody murder once I leave our room and get closer to her room. The sound also quit working. We managed for a while with the sound issue by carrying around a basic monitor for sound. Once the screen froze over and over, we decided to buy another one, hoping we just got.a "dud". Our current one was purchased April 2011. It too has started freezing. We have moved into a larger house, so we definitely rely on the monitor to hear her since our room is at the other side of the house. We are going to purchase a Motorola monitor in hopes of a better product.

Reviews.Title: Best baby product I ever bought
Reviews.Author: 1st time mom
Reviews.Content: Another mom referred this product to me and I absolutely love it.  I have had it for 1.5 years and it's the best.  I love being able to see if he's crying standing up or lying down.  If he's lying down and he cries some, I know he'll go back to sleep.  If he's standing up, then I know he must need something.  It's so helpful.  I can even see if he's standing in his crib and pooping!  Only problem is right now the cord to the baby monitor broke so I am contacting the company to see if they can replace the cord.  Otherwise, this has been an excellent product.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Debra Schoenrock
Reviews.Content: We have used this monitor for both of our kids and it is really great. The sound and the image are excellent. I feel so secure being able to see what is going on, much more comforting than sounds alone!

Reviews.Title: Works pretty good, very nice clear picture
Reviews.Author: Gene
Reviews.Content: Overall we really like this camera and are about to buy another one for our new addition to the family.  The picture is very clear during the day and night.  Music is very nice and soothing.  The monitor itself works over great distance and has no problems with reception through walls and several flight of stairs.  There are just few things that can work better, but we learned to live with them.  Firstly, you need to shut off the camera part of the unit when you are not using it, since it tends to overheat if left plugged in all the time.  So you will need to remember to switch it off in the morning after all night use.  Secondly, the stand for the camera is completely useless, it is almost impossible to steady the camera in the desired direction.  We just used a bit of tape to make the neck of the base more sturdy, and fixed the camera in place that way.  Thirdly, the sounds outside are setting the monitor off, like motorcycles and loud cars, but we got used to tuning those out.  The worst problem is the wireless interference with other signals.  Whenever we need to use our wireless Internet we just switch the camera  off for a little while.  Besides those few little things the camera works really well, and gave us a piece of mind about bed time, since we can see exactly what is going on if need be, very convenient.  I would recommend buying it!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Lucky4Life
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product last year (September 2010). Granted, the video quality was sub par and the sound was of poor quality (especially the annoying buzzing noise when you increase the volume), but it did it's job. I was able to monitor my daughter which was number one priority. Unfortunately, the product started to malfunction soon after the year warranty expired (white screen on monitor with black blotches on it). I contacted customer services to see if my monitor could be repaired. They informed me that it could not because it was after the warranty date. All they could offer me was to buy another monitor at $80.00. I informed then I didn't want to buy another monitor just to have it die a year later. I offered to pay for the repairs myself (in hopes I could save some money), but they stated they don't repair any products after the year warranty. It is disappointing that a product that at paid $164 only lasted a year. Apparently from the other reviews I have read on Amazon.com other purchasers have also had their monitor malfunction soon after the year warranty expired. I cannot recommended this produce due to it's short product life, sub par video quality and annoying buzzing when one raises the volume. Disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Great Monitor
Reviews.Author: sanka
Reviews.Content: We bought this monitor Sept. 2009 and it's still working -- 2 years and 2 months so far! I don't usually write reviews, but I felt compelled to write a review for a product that has exceeded my expectations. We love the monitor because we can see our little guy when he's sleeping or when he should be sleeping. If he's awake during nap time, we watch him to make sure he doesn't climb out of his crib and we can go in if he's trying really hard and is halfway on the rail. I highly recommend this monitor!Update: it finally broke on March 2013. It's one of the longest lasting technical gadgets we've bought!

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: D. Chai
Reviews.Content: Range is a little bit off, but otherwise works like a charm and really useful, since baby sleeps upstairs and you can do your work downstairs without worrying if baby is suffocating or something.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: 8-D Dave
Reviews.Content: With baby monitors, I have lesrned the hard way that you get what you pay for.  This is one of the more inexpensive models, therefore is one of the cheapest.  I gave it 2 stars because it's not horrible,, bot not somehting I can recommned either.  We noticed that the night vision illuminators would flicker and the picture freeze every few seconds.  As a result, we sent it in for warranry repair and the company made it very clear that it would take up to 6 weeks to have the monitor returned.  Well, our monitor returned almost 6 weeks later with the same problems.  For new parents... let me just tell you that a 6 week turnaround time is unacceptable when you have a newborn (something Levana oddly doesn't recognize).In less than a year, the next problem was that the power recepticle on the monitor broke into the unit so it would no longer be charged.  Rather than send it in again, wait another 6 weeks for the repaired unit, we bought a much more expensive monitor from motorola.  Motorola Digital Video Baby Monitor with 3.5 Inch Color LCD Screen.  This monitor is leaps and bounds better than the levana.  Also you can remotely control the monitor to move it where your baby is in the crib, and it monitors the temperature in the room.  Something the Levana could not do.  Also the Levana often lost signal to the camera one house floor below where the baby was sleeping.  The motorola in this review could effortlessly get a signal in the basement of the hous.My advice to you, is dont do what I did by buying this sheap one, sending it back once leaving us without a montor for weeks, then have to send it in again because the power blug broke.  Just spend the extra $100 for one that will just work.

Reviews.Title: DOA - Dead on Arrival!
Reviews.Author: Jen S.
Reviews.Content: Just a word of caution... this was fulfilled by Amazon, sold by Shoptronics.  The monitor arrived in dirty dinged up packaging and clearly was used.  Gave it the benefit of the doubt, set it up, the monitor screen refused to turn on.  Called the customer service number on the box, waited 20 minutes to be connected to an actual person who then told me it was a "Level 2 Technical Issue" and they would call me back.  That was several days ago.  I have not been called back.  Returned the product to Amazon and will not be buying another of this same model, since you never know what you're going to get and the customer service is atrocious.  Bought a Summer Night & Day instead and it's working great thus far although it lacks bells & whistles at least it works.  A word to the wise, buy an external warranty (like from Square Trade) because Levana's customer service has proven to be an absolute nightmare so it would be nice to have a backup plan!UPDATE: As of 12/7/11, several WEEKS after initiating contact with their customer service for help since the monitor didn't work straight out of the box, they STILL haven't called back and it's impossible to get an actual person on the line at this point.

Reviews.Title: Poor customer support
Reviews.Author: A.D. "A.D."
Reviews.Content: I ordered this item in June 2011 and by November, the battery had died.  I contacted customer service and they replaced the battery promptly.  Overall the monitor has good video quality and decent sound.  I am overall satisfied with this monitor.

Reviews.Title: Levana- wouldnt recommend
Reviews.Author: GnLSoul
Reviews.Content: I would NOT recommend this item. First off, it freezes on me all the time, not ideal when you want to know exactly what is going on. It also constantly cuts out to a white screen and says 'out of range'. I am not satisfied with this item and would not suggest it to anyone !Also, I do not like how it attatches to the crib. The camera is too close, so you only see a small part of the crib area. My daughter moves all over so I need to be able to see the whole crib. Also, when you need to adjust where the camera points it doesnt always adjust easily. There are much nicer cameras out there worth spending your money on to make sure you can see your child.

Reviews.Title: One year life isn't enough
Reviews.Author: BKK Reviewer
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement for our first monitor, which was identical to this. We liked it enough that we bought a second, but you've got to ask yourself, is the price worth just one year's use. Or you could ask yourself, do I feel lucky? In any case, we felt strongly enough about it to just cut our losses and take a risk that we'll either get another year out of the new one or that it will last longer.  When it works, it's fabulously easy to use and works incredibly well. Our now-2yo son has become accustomed to falling asleep to the tunes on it, and we're becoming so old aged that we didn't want to have him teach us how to use a newer model. Don't believe people who say you don't need a camera baby monitor; hey, we have the technology, why not use it? You're going to want to know what the little one is up to. At 2yo, we now want to know more than ever! Hence our re-purchase of this staple of of lives after 8 p.m. Just don't expect to be able to Google the battery and find a replacement.

Reviews.Title: Great baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: After doing so much research on monitors we finally picked this one and we made the right choice. We've been using since the baby turned 3 months old as we moved him from bassinet to crib. He's now 8 months old and we haven't run into any issues with the camera/monitor. We use it every night and for his naps. We live in an apt with wi-fi so interference free feature was a huge selling point especially with neighbors close by. I love the VOX (voice activated feature) so the screen doesn't have to be on the whole time especially during the night when you can occasionally catch some zzzzz's and not be disturbed by the bright light. The feed goes out if I place the monitor in the living room, which is the farthest from the baby's room but it usually kicks back on in a few seconds. There are minimal walls so not sure why it goes out. It holds it's charge really well. I keep it charged at night on my nightstand and take it with to the kitchen/living room when he naps during the day. The color image they show on the product description is not so accurate at least for me it isn't but not a big deal. I usually keep his curtain down when he naps anyway and don't require the color but a nice feature. Volume is great. I've used the music feature here and there, doesn't really do it for my little one but you never know and I'm glad it had it just in case. The camera is easy to mount. We actually use a digital camera holder that the camera can screw on to and we attach it to the railing. He's not able to reach it since we lowered his mattress but he does try, I think he likes the light. All and all, I'm glad I went with this product and it hasn't let me down. I feel so much better at night knowing that this works and I can watch my little one to see what trouble he's getting into.

Reviews.Title: Impressive video display
Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: I have yet to use my own monitor since I haven't yet had my baby, however, I did purchase one after seeing a friends and their recommendation. I was very impressed with how nice the picture quality the monitor had(day and night vision) as well as the other features (lullaby and night light options) while on a camping trip with some friends that had this one. It will be nice to know when I will really need to go in to check on our baby or when he's just fussing a bit before putting himself back to sleep. I did shop around for other video monitors just to compare but the Levana was still the winner and I look forward to using it soon!  -Kelly

Reviews.Title: HUGE disappointment!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: within the first several weeks with this monitor, the belt clip broke off the back. Although it didn't affect the function of it, it did inhibit the monitors ability to stand upright. Now, after owning the monitor for 16 months, the antenna has somehow loosened enough that it frequently comes out, the sound does not work and doesn't register the green bars. The cord is too short to mount high enough on the wall to see a broader view of the childs room. I would NOT recommend this monitor!!

Reviews.Title: Unreliable Monitor - Terrible Customer Service
Reviews.Author: jackiejeanne
Reviews.Content: Initially this monitor was exactly what we wanted.  The picture quality isn't great but it worked for what we needed.  When the picture was on, the monitor made a loud buzzing noise that I couldn't sleep through so I came to love the VOX option - turns sound and screen off unless baby makes a sound loud enough to set it off - usually the sound of the screen coming on was enough to wake me up to check on the baby.  This feature ended up being the downfall of the monitor.The first problem I noticed with the monitor was the frequent "Out Of Range" message that came on the screen accompanied by a loud set of beeps.  This would happen increasingly frequently regardless of whether we were 10 feet down the hall from the kids, or  across the house on a separate floor.  We called customer service who instructed us to re-sync our monitor to camera and told us to give it some time.  The message continued.  I'm not sure exactly when this next problem started because, unfortunately, being on separate floors, without the monitor we cannot hear the kids.  When out of town one weekend I had the monitor sitting right in front of me (no "out of range" message) and I hear my daughter screaming bloody murder from upstairs.  The monitor showed nothing.  I rushed upstairs to find my daughter completely distraught.  This was the first of 3 times that I had this experience before purchasing a new monitor (when I found out I was expecting another child).  I would hear my child screaming and crying and check the monitor to find that not only did it show no signs that my child was making any noise (it has a noise level indicator) when I turned the screen on manually it would take a second and then I would hear by daughter loud and clear.  I began getting up frequently throughout the night just to check to see if she was alright and the monitor slowly became completely pointless.  I cannot imagine leaving my child's safety (especially that of a newborn) and my own mental ease in the hands of this company.Before purchasing a new monitor I did call Levana customer service who informed me that even thought the monitor had been in use less than 9 months, they would not replace the monitor.  They had no instructions for me on how I might fix it and simply encouraged me to buy another monitor by offering 20% off of my next purchase.After this experience I would not use another Levana monitor if they gave it to me for free.  I'm completely terrified by the thought of what could have happened to my child because of this faulty monitor and trust that put in it.

Reviews.Title: It Works, but could be improved!!
Reviews.Author: mduntapnotch
Reviews.Content: This monitor definitely does its job!  We still had some difficulty with the interference with our internet connection, but for the most part, it works and we can still surf the web.  The picture quality could be a little better.  Some other monitors we have tried have way better picture quality, but all the others seem to interfere with out internet connection.  For the most part, the sound/movement recognition works great!  We have stuck with this monitor, so that says something.  We are actually looking into purchasing another monitor.  I do wish that this monitor allowed you to have two cameras work at the same time.

Reviews.Title: Good product, but minor problems
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: I originally bought this monitor for my daughter (22 mo).  I loved it so much that I bought a second one when my son came along.  I have not had any problems with the original one that I bought, but the one I recently bought (a few months ago)has frozen twice in the middle of the night.  This causes quite a problem when my infant is screaming, but the monitor says he's sleeping soundly.  I'm not sure if this is just a defective product or a problem with the brand.  I've never had a problem with the first one I bought.  I still recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great Monitor
Reviews.Author: Beach Dad
Reviews.Content: Definitely a great buy. With all the wireless interference in our home and our neighbor's homes this monitor has worked great. Very easy to use with some nice built-in features like the night light and being able to set the video to sound activation so you can sleep without the hum of the handset. Overall an excellent monitor for the price and features.

Reviews.Title: Great deal - completely portable!!!
Reviews.Author: Baudran
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this monitor as I wanted one that was completely portable without having to bring any A/C adapters when I traveled. Most monitors allow for portable handsets, but require the cameras to be plugged in - this monitor allows the camera to be plugged in OR use batteries.  There were only 2 other monitors that I found (at least from easily searching) that cost at least double. Don't waste the money!  This monitor works great!!!The screen is a bit small and quality isn't 100% crisp so if you want to see every movement your baby makes this may not be for you, but for our family this definitely does the trick.  This is a great deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: easy to use overall great monitor
Reviews.Author: hunter5436
Reviews.Content: I went through 2 other monitors before settling with this one. It is truly interference free. It's easy to carry around the house given its small size. I bought one for my older daughter and was hoping to use it again for my younger daughter. The rechargable battery, however, needed to be replaced after 1 year of use since it wouldn't charge up anymore, making it difficult to use since the handheld part had to be plugged into the wall constantly (defeating the whole purpose of a handheld portable monitor). You can purchase a new rechargable battery for replacement. I just decided to buy a second one for my second child rather than replace the battery. I definitely recommend this monitor because it's easy to use. I think it's worth the money. I don't really use the night light function since it's not very bright. The music is great.

Reviews.Title: Cute device middle of the road performance
Reviews.Author: David Rivera
Reviews.Content: The BabyView 20 is a nicely looking baby monitor. Setup was fairly straight forward and was up and running within 5 minutes of plugging everything in.  The screen portion is lightweight and has decent battery life.  The camera portion has infrared L.E.D.s that tend to blink sporadically and image quality is fair at best.  The rounded camera is difficult to aim without using the screw attachment to steady it.  Using the pictured magnetic base is not very convenient because the AC adapter cord tends to pull on the camera and turn it towards wherever the cable is coming from. The automatic sound feature is inconvenient because it is factory preset at some level that may or may not work with the ambient noise level in your child's room. In our case it kicks in at several times depending on the level of sound made by the background/sleep music in our child's room.  In other words, we can here only the mid to high volume sounds in the room (which is fine for toddler because he really makes noise when he needs a bottle or a diaper change). I would not recommend it for newborns or infants, because you may not hear the lower volume fussing sounds that you would normally want to check out to see if they are too cold or uncomfortable. This unit is also prone to losing its connection between the camera and monitor once or twice a week and has a loud warning tone that will scare the crap out of you in the middle of the night.I returned the first unit that we purchased because of the disconnection problem and customer service was fairly responsive and sent a replacement unit that has a bigger noise insulator on the AC adapter cord that has reduced the problem to the aforementioned once or twice a week issue (inconvenient but bearable).Overall it's not a bad unit for the price.  We have tried several other brands already over the course of two years and those literally fell to pieces from wear and tear (and we are very careful with our gadgets). The other units had inferior picture quality, inferior battery capacity and poor build quality at a higher price point (because of the brand name).  From what I've seen there really isn't a bullet proof baby monitor solution on the market for less than $200 and I can't speak to anything above that price point because for the money I can (and did) setup an ip camera which I can view in a web browser or in a smartphone app (yes the one with an "i" and the one with the robot also) all with sound and have some money leftover for dinner for two at a local restaurant.

Reviews.Title: It's okay...
Reviews.Author: Keith G. "HeadhunterMdR"
Reviews.Content: It does what it supposed to do, however the antenna cover comes off easily and the product information is incorrect.  Our primary reason for buying this unit was to look into the crib.  The telescopic arm advertised is no longer sold with the unit therefore it cannot be attached to the crib.  Therefore we have to balance it on other pieces of furniture to look into the crib.  That is why I give it 3 out of 5 stars.  The unit should be discounted at least $25.00 due to the missing arm and false advertisement.  I called the manufacture and they said they no longer produce the arm.

Reviews.Title: not worth it in the long run
Reviews.Author: fmsv
Reviews.Content: We've had the Levana Babyview20 for a little over 1 year and have had issues with the sound quality, image quality and charging function.  It was an expensive purchase and so we tried to use it for as long as possible, but it finally just stopped working and wouldn't charge at all.  We attempted Customer Service, but between the delay in getting it fixed through them (they would take 3 weeks to check it and identify the problem, and wouldn't replace it anyway because we'd had it over a year), it was less frustrating to buy a new one.Here are the cons:- poor image quality;- it's supposed to go on when the baby cries, but there is delay and the baby oftens cries a while before the monitor registers the sound;- conversely, monitor is so sensitive to background noise it goes off because of the fan or heater in the room;- the position of the transformer on the electrical cord makes mounting the monitor on the magnetic base difficult as it topples over if you set it at the "wrong" angle (how is that helpful when you should be able to customize the view?)- stopped charging altogetherOf course, this last issue was the final straw.  At about 7 or 8 months, we had noticed that every once in a while the monitor seemed to need to be charged at night(even though we kept it charging during the day).  We put it down to our oversight; maybe we hadn't connected it properly and therefore it wasn't charging.  In the last month, we noticed it more and more and had to hold the cord to the monitor in order to get an image at all. Finally, it stopped working completely and won't charge even if we hold it together. We're very disappointed with the device and with customer service.  A monitor this expensive should be usable for much longer than this one was.  DO NOT PURCHASE THIS ITEM.

Reviews.Title: Wireless Video Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Sherry A. Merriman Budge "SamB"
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our son's new baby.  They say that it is WONDERFUL as they can check in on him when he's upstairs in his crib.  They no longer have to keep going up and downstairs in order to juse SEE that he's really ok.  Also, NO INTERFERENCE and a clear picture.  THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: Levana Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: N. Neringa "XO"
Reviews.Content: Great product, recommended to two of my friends and both of them are very happy with it. Great sound and image quality, I would definitely recommend !!!!

Reviews.Title: I love this monitor
Reviews.Author: H. Fitzgibbons
Reviews.Content: The picture is so clear and accurate, i can see my baby's stomach moving :)Also the lullaby feature is awesome for buying some extra time in bed.Highly recommend this to any parent.

Reviews.Title: Levana BABYVIEW20
Reviews.Author: Harry Costa
Reviews.Content: We used several baby monitors in the past, however our experience with Levana Babyview 20 buts this monitor in a class of it's own. The sound, video and interference-free quality are second to none.

Reviews.Title: Good monitor with minor issues
Reviews.Author: Lili
Reviews.Content: This is the first monitor I have.  It is good and satisfies us.  You can keep your baby sleep in his crib while you have dinner outside with this monitor turned on.  Similarly, you can be away from your baby when he sleeps, but keep an eye him with this monitor. You are better assured when you can see him instead of relying on his sound only.One thing this monitor may be improved is that: it gives you large sound when a bus comes by, but the sound of the bus is not that loud.We had a question about how to set the monitor, because we could not find the attachment used to set the monitor on the crib.  Then we found out that the attachment is no longer supplied because of safety.  We understand this, but this brings the question that where and how can we set the monitor.  Finally, we put the monitor on a frame aside the crib...

Reviews.Title: Pretty good, especially for the price
Reviews.Author: Andrew Kyle
Reviews.Content: We've used this monitor for about 5 months now. Contrary to some of the other reviews, I found the audio and video quality to be pretty good (I guess it depends how far away you install the camera). It's enough to see her face so I can reposition her if I don't like her sleeping angles. We paid closer to $200, it looks like it's $130 now.We did have a problem with the monitor's battery, but customer service was good and they resolved the issue.I would buy this item again.-Andrew

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Kris W.
Reviews.Content: I've had a few monitors, and for the price, this is  a good deal.What I like:-It's easy to set up-The camera is easy to position thanks to the shape/design-I don't have to hear "noise" all of the time-The picture quality is decentWhat I don't like:-It goes "out of range" every so often - I've noticed that happens when my cell phone is next to it-The VOX sound function isn't perfect.  Sometimes my son is talking and the monitor is silent.  Kinda frustrating to hear him across the house but not on the monitor.I do wish it was too way so we could say "go back to bed!" when he is up and playing.Overall, a good product.  You really can't find similar features in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Great product!  I highly recommend!
Reviews.Author: Evan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were growing tired of our first baby monitor.  We were using the traditional, sound only, has-to-plug-into-an-outlet-to-work baby monitor.  Every time we heard the slightest disturbance, we would rush into our daughter's room to find that she was fine.  A good friend of ours had mentioned that she uses a Babyview 20 monitor, and that it was "the best baby product they had ever purchased."  Needless to say, we did some research.  We found the price is quite affordable and that most people seem to be very happy with this product.  So, we bought one.The Babyview 20 has been nothing short of a dream come true.  The night vision camera is perfect!  We can see our daughter's every move, day or night.  **If you have your bedroom light on, the monitor displays video in perfect color.**The sound quality isn't the best you'll ever hear, but it is certainly good enough.  Some people complain in their reviews about how the sound turns on and off frequently.  This doesn't bother us at all, in fact, it's awesome.  When we are sleeping, we hate the annoying "hissing" sound from our old baby monitor.  The Babyview 20 only plays sound when a loud-enough sound occurs near the camera.  We sleep much better, and have never been awakened because our daughter rolled over and made a slight noise.The battery life is excellent.  We usually plug it in to charge over night and it lasts all day - no matter how many naps she might take.The signal used to transmit audio and video from the camera to the monitor is digital.  This means no interference.  We have never experienced any interference.  The signal is perfectly private and secure.I also remember reading that some people experienced problems if they used wireless internet.  We have a CISCO wi-fi router with broadband internet.  We have a desktop PC, a laptop, a wireless printer, and a playstation 3 that are all connected to our home wireless network.  We often use several of these devices simultaneously with the Babyview 20 and have never experienced any issues - none whatsoever.I highly recommend this feature to anyone who wants piece of mind, without having to constantly be "hovering" over their child.  We have taken ours on vacation so we can truly say that we don't leave town without it.

Reviews.Title: BABYVIEW20
Reviews.Author: HPD202 "L. Natelborg"
Reviews.Content: Great monitor.  Works even while at our neighbors house.  Great price too.  Bought the monitor after another competitors failed....should of bought this one first.

Reviews.Title: Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: momof2
Reviews.Content: I purchased Babyview20 Video Baby Monitor as a replacement for our first video monitor (Graco).  I was overall disappointed with this monitor.  The video screen on the monitor is very bright making it hard for me to sleep with it on.  It does have a VOX feature where the video & audio cut off to save batteries and cut back on when a set level of sound is heard from baby's room.  This did not work well in practice.  The monitor made a loud clicking sound when turning on/off...waking me up several times during the night, even when baby didn't need anything.  It appeared to do this even if baby only turned over or moved in bed.  It would be better if video & audio could be controlled separately-allowing you to turn on/off the video monitor at will & leave audio running all the time at whatever volume you chose.  My monitor broke after 6 months of use-made a loud clicking sound in the night & shut off.  It has not worked since.  I found customer service hours not user friendly for a parent with small children-they are not available on weekends or evenings.  It is nearly impossible to place a call & wait on hold during 9-5pm business hours with multiple little ones at home.  I tried once, reached voicemail, left a message & missed their call the following day.  I have now placed an email request via their website & am awaiting a reply.

Reviews.Title: GREAT monitor!!
Reviews.Author: J. Moore "Mommy"
Reviews.Content: We LOVE this monitor! I love that the handset has the monitor on it so I can take it downstairs and still be able to see my sleeping baby. The nightvision is amazing- it looks like we have a light on in her room. The sound is great too. It goes on when there is a sound in her room, so there is no buzzing feedback all night. And if it is charged, it will definitely go all night without being plugged in. The only "bad" thing about this particular package though; is that it did not come with a mounting bracket. We had purchased this from Costco (not sure if I can say that?) with my son and their "bundle" came with a mounting bracket. Hmmm... maybe it's just missing from mine... I guess I will have to contact the seller to see about that. But LOVE this monitor!!

Reviews.Title: Good but wish I could add an additional camera
Reviews.Author: ShopHappy
Reviews.Content: Overall, a good monitor for one room. The battery will last all night if you keep it in VOX mode (the video will pop on when audio in the baby's room is detected). Unlike Mobicam Digital Monitoring system, you can set VOX mode from the receiver instead of the camera. We actually had to return our first one because of a weird buzzing sound, got a replacement, then it stopped taking a charge after using it multiple times daily for about 18 months. So, my expectations we not that it should last forever, but it is definitely better than some of the other monitors we've tried. I did not buy another because we now need 2 cameras and this is not compatible. FYI - we bought and returned the 2-camera Levana version. It is nothing like this Babyview20. I don't know why the products differ so much. So, we are still searching for the right 2-camera system (with no luck...).

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny!  Look no further!
Reviews.Author: Annette
Reviews.Content: I have had this product for two years now and I absolutely love it!  The only issue I have had is after about a year the lithium ion battery for the monitor died and I had to buy a new one.  Customer service was very helpful and the battery was not that expensive.  Also, my husband reminded me of one BIG FLAW that I had managed to overlook.  When it is in VOX status if there is any sound or movement the picture does not come on!  You get a white screen and you have to turn the unit off and on to get a picture.  I spoke to customer service and they said the monitor and the camera had to be synched again.  I followed their instruction but it did not help.  This problem is enough for my husband to not want another monitor from Levana for our second child so it is worth mentioning.  The picture quality is excellent and I love the night vision capability.  I have to say when my daughter was really young the ability to press a button and play a lullaby was PRICELESS.  There were times when I would be busy and couldn't get to her right away and I played the lullaby and it worked like a charm.Improvements I would like to see are as follows:Add the ability to pan or zoomNight lights should not be on the cameraGreen indicator light on the camera is so bright I had to cover that with a piece of cardboardShould have the ability to add cameras

Reviews.Title: Like it, but has a designn flaw
Reviews.Author: Sarah L.
Reviews.Content: I use this every night and for naptimes. I think it's indispensable. However, there is one design flaw that I think is worth pointing out. You must be very careful in the way that you hold the monitor. The buttons to activate the music are right on the side of the screen and are too easy to press by accident when you are handling the monitor. I have accidentally started up the music a few times and woke up my baby unitentionally. Any parent who has just left the room after spending half the night putting your child down only to have them pop back up because you accidentally started to play music in their crib can understand this is hugely frustrating. Everytime I give the device to someone who is not familiar with it, I have to yell, "don't touch the sides!!" I would suggest that future generations of this product either re-position the buttons to the front of the monitor or implement a lock feature like cell phones and tablets have that would prevent this from happeneing.

Reviews.Title: do not waste your money on this item
Reviews.Author: mdsith
Reviews.Content: Worst product I have ever purchased, Looses signal, weak battery,camera does not sinc with the monitor.  Tech dept very poor - says the problem is the battery needs to be replaced, when the unit is working on electric power and the battery is not in the unit. Product says it has a 1 year guarantee,but the company is unwilling to provide service without making you jump through all sort of hoops.  This is a really bad product - don't rely on it to monitor your baby - DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PRODUCT.

Reviews.Title: Broke after 5 months...poor customer service
Reviews.Author: K. Gretzula
Reviews.Content: Our son was born February 2011 and initially we really liked the babyview monitor. It didn't interfere with any wireless and had decent picture and sound.However after 5 months of use it broke. The pin to plug in the charger to the monitor broke off so we were unable to charge the unit. This happened at 8pm and of course no one was available to speak to us or tell us how to try to fix it. We had to wait for a phone call back from them 2 days later. We paid shipping to return it to them and it was returned to us 3 weeks later after constant calls from us as to why it was taking so long. The returned unit is much worse in my opinion. The "refurbished" unit now:-emits a constant buzz when the picture is on-interferes with the wireless-the picture and sound are choppy-does not have a convenient mounting unit for the camera (our old one had a clamp to mount to the crib--Levana said it was recalled and gave us just a little platform for the camera which cannot be mounted to the crib)We have since contacted the company who said we can ship it back to them (again with us paying for the shipping) for them to try to fix it again! We may just take a loss on this one.The only pros I can think of (going off of our original unit) were:-decent picture (the night vision is better than daylight)-dial controlled volumecons:-no option for constant sound---it will only turn on with a LOUD sound-lullaby is kind of useless, we never needed it-no option to manually turn the screen on and offWe purchased the summer infant slim and secure to use while this one was getting "fixed" and really like it. The picture quality is good, it has a constant sound option and you can turn the screen off while you sleep. The only downside in my opinion is that it's push button volume so you can't control how loud the sound gets as well (just a personal preference).

Reviews.Title: Excellent Monitor; getting another one
Reviews.Author: Katheryn Bilbo
Reviews.Content: We've been using this monitor for 2 years, with no issues.  The signal is, as the description says, interference free, so there's no worry about static or interference from other electronics such as wireless telephones. Range is good, and the battery still lasts all night, despite having used it every night now for 24 months. I loved the monitor when we first starting using it, but thought surely it would die after a year or so, but it's still working like the day we got it.The picture quality is great, with absolutely no static. (Please note that you will only get a color screen when there is light in the room. When dark, the infrared camera will return a black and white picture.) The mounting hardware allows the camera to be attached to a crib for a close up view of your sleeping infant, or further away on a bookshelf for a wider view. (The closer the camera is to the baby, the more sensitive the microphone is). It's also very easy to move, which is useful for packing it up for a trip to the relatives.With a 2nd baby on the way, we are totally getting another one. We didn't even bother to look at other models. It's been so reliable and easy to use, there was just no question about which video monitor we would get for the new baby's room.

Reviews.Title: be careful
Reviews.Author: brian
Reviews.Content: looks good, lots of good reviews, says it comes with a crib mount, but actually got it today with a sticker tha says "crib mount removed". so basically, $200 down the drain, what the hell do i do with a monitoring system that does not monitor because i cannot place it anyway. its its not something you can through together for a mounting system, not pleased.

Reviews.Title: Poor design and features
Reviews.Author: Big B
Reviews.Content: I previously had the Summer Infant Best View and LOVED it.  Unfortunately, they "upgraded" their model which was for the worst, so I tried a new brand.  Extremely disappointed- The hand held monitor is plastic and very cheaply made.  It has no battery level indicator, so you can't tell how much charge is left.The picture quality is decent, which is the only reason I have anything good to say about this camera, but seriously, WHO designed this thing?  There is a BRIGHT red light on the FRONT of the camera shining right in the baby's eyes... the buttons on the side of the monitor to turn on the music, is right next to the VOX button to turn off the screen.  So at 3am, when fumbling around trying to turn on or off the screen, you could very easily hit the music button- waking up the baby even more.  Dumb placement of these buttons.  Plus, there is NO WAY to turn off the monitor screen and leave the sound up unless you use the VOX, but if you have a humidifier or fan, then it automatically turns it back on all the time!  So forget about using this camera if you use any type of other white noise in the room or a humidifier.  There is no pan or zoom like the Summer Infant, so the camera must be in one place.  This is fine for newborns, but when they get older, it's nice to be able to pan around the room, or zoom in.  So I am returning this camera after only 2 days, because it is just the worst design and camera I've seen.  Sad, because the picture quality is actually pretty decent, but all of the other "features" makes it worthless.

Reviews.Title: Love this monitor!
Reviews.Author: Amanda Vivs
Reviews.Content: Clear picture, love the lullaby feature, and has great reception! I would recommend this to a friend or family member.

Reviews.Title: Terrible battery and the worse customer service ever..
Reviews.Author: Walter
Reviews.Content: The battery ran out after six months and the monitor voice was really bad. They wanted me to buy a new battery for $20 (still didn't find any store where to buy a new one so it has to be plugged in..). Then we found out that it wasn't the battery but it's defective. It was almost impossible reach someone from the customer service.. if so, they send you some paperwork to be filled out (impossible to return with so many rules)Finally they told me if the product is not defective they will send it back at my own expense...

Reviews.Title: Solid gold.
Reviews.Author: Doha Guy
Reviews.Content: I've had this for about a year now and all I can say is....it works for me.When I started looking for a monitor, the main things I was looking for was infrared and range. I've got this perched over our son's cot and it works awesome. Yeah, there is a little red light on it but it's no big deal. It's never bothered my son and lets me know when the batteries are starting to go (it starts to blink). The attachment it comes with to clamp it on things works perfectly- we have it clamped to a closet door near his cot and it picks up everything, even when it's completely dark. A set of decent AAA batteries will last you for well more than a few hours and as far as the range goes, it will penetrate anything. We live in a solid concrete villa with our bedroom on the back side of the second floor. Through all the concrete, doors and windows, I can still get a signal from across the street with the monitor. And speaking of the monitor, the battery in that lasts forever. We use ours every night for about 2 or 3 hours and charge it about once a month. It couldn't get any easier...I also want to thank Amazon for shipping it so fast- I ordered this from the Middle East and it took 4 days to get to me and one of those was a Sunday. Well done!

Reviews.Title: Great For Video I use sound monitor as back up
Reviews.Author: Corrine`
Reviews.Content: I could never live without this monitor. I noticed 2 times in the 11 months we have used it that the screen froze but turning it off and back on fixed it. I have badly dropped the monitor a few times and it still rocks! The mounts are limited and the screw gets weak not worth not looking at it. Just get a mini tripod from anywhere for like 10 bucks! Extra cords would be a nice bonus but batteries are good! I use a secondary monitor because with my sons health we needed a monitor (angel care) with alarms sounding if the baby stops moving, heart stops beating or breathing. but nothings as nice as the bonus of seeing him. I ended up here because I may buy the model that is just a camera and it can be viewed on laptop or phone app which would be cool but for now I'm blessed and have told all new parents this is a must buy ANY video monitor is a good idea.

Reviews.Title: Good monitor but definitely not interference-free
Reviews.Author: Christy C
Reviews.Content: We have been using this monitor every day and night now for the past year.  We have it clamped on bookshelves above the crib, out of the reach of our daughter.  This monitor does a great job on imaging and sound.  I find that it is a real-time image (I can watch her breathe) and while I used to wish that I could hear every little noise, now I am happy that it just clicks on for the more substantial noises.The songs are a very annoying addition to this monitor.  I never found that it soothed her, and there have been very untimely accidents where my finger has slipped and turned it on.  The nightlight has held no use for us, but it makes for a cute circle of stars :)I love that unlike much of what I have read online about other monitors, this does not seem to pick up images outside of our house because of the digital feed.  Makes me feel secure that our images aren't being broadcast either.All that said, this is definitely not interference-free.  It hasn't made us look for another monitor though - it is just a nuisance.  The microwave and wireless internet are the culprits.  If I have the monitor in the kitchen and cooking dinner - loud beep and "out of range."  If we download songs online - same story.  Accessing our wireless shared hard drive produces the same result.  In a particularly long download, the monitor will stay out of range for the entire process.  Very annoying.It's super portable and keeps the battery during her day naps.  At night, I keep it plugged in next to our bed.  We have gotten much use out of this and I anticipate we will continue to use it for awhile!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Monitor!
Reviews.Author: TypeA
Reviews.Content: I tried a few monitors and this one was by far the very best. Excellent picture, no static, long range and overall a very high quality product. I highly recommend this monitor to anyone wanting a video monitor.

Reviews.Title: After one year, the camera has stopped working.
Reviews.Author: eileen17a
Reviews.Content: I received this monitor a year and a half ago and have been having problems for the past few months.  First off, the sound is very loud with lots of static when the camera is just on.  Second, the monitor is no longer receiving a signal when it's only a few feet away from the camera.  I hate to buy another camera but it appears I'm going to have to.  Something this expensive should last much longer.  Would not recommend purchasing this camera.

Reviews.Title: Short lifespan
Reviews.Author: D. Welsh
Reviews.Content: Same basic issue as a few other reviewers have mentioned - the monitor has suddenly stopped working. It would appear that power is no longer reaching the monitor/battery even though the power adapter is working just fine, tested the adapter with a simple DC current tester.  Upon closer inspection, I can see inside the power input port on the monitor, where the adapter plugs-in, that the center pin has broken off - hence, the power adapter is no longer able to provide power to the monitor.This is very unfortunate as, in general, we really liked this monitor with only one minor gripe as others have mentioned - seems it has a sensor for the audio (presumably the same one used for the VOX feature) and sometimes it takes a second or two for the audio to kick-in.  We've only owned this unit for 7 months and it's definitely on the higher end, around $175 when we purchased.  In general, the build quality looks very good but there is an obvious flaw with the build quality of the power input jack, unfortunate that such a simple component can ruin the whole device.  Still under warranty, will post an update once I get some resolution from Levana.

Reviews.Title: works ok, for a few months...
Reviews.Author: nbgby
