Reviews.Content: I have been using this monitor for 12 months now. The first few months it worked ok. But now the picture is always going out and it doesn't hold charge like it used to. I have also noticed it doesn't even pick up sound right away. Sometimes i'll hear my daughter before the monitor even kicks on. Also the handset loses the camera signal constantly. I'm expecting again and we are already looking for a new monitor. This one is definatly not dependable enough for a newborn.

Reviews.Title: Great monitor, love it!
Reviews.Author: uscfan81
Reviews.Content: We love this monitor.  Our daughter is 1 and we still use it on voice activated mode.  It is easy to put anywhere in her room.  The range is pretty good within the house and we have visual on her almost anywhere.

Reviews.Title: baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Julie Diaz
Reviews.Content: This is the second Levana camera I purchased. I loved the first and had no problems with it. It was reasonably priced, so when I had my second child, I bought another one. This second unit is not the same. It freezes at times when the monitor is not plugged in, so I see a sleeping baby in the picture and hear him crying. It also has more trouble keeping the picture. The original unit started giving a loud hum after 14 months of use and can only be used with the sound off (to see the baby).I called the company about the second camera as the first was past the warranty & they informed me that I could send it in to be looked at, but if there was nothing they could find wrong, the shipping cost would be mine to get it back. I would also be out a camera for the several weeks for it to be looked at. I would spend more money and buy a better unit. I will use this one when travelling (no fear if it gets broken) as long as I didn't depend on seeing a true picture. I would not recommend this to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Love the Levana
Reviews.Author: allie
Reviews.Content: We received this monitor as a baby shower gift and we are so happy with it!  Easy to set up and very portable.  Our favorite feature is the lullaby button, which helps put our son to sleep MANY nights:)  The screen could be a bit bigger, but overall we are very happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Works like it should
Reviews.Author: Brad Harding
Reviews.Content: We have been using this monitor for 19 months now and have had zero problems. The house we own is four levels and no matter which level we are on, we still get a strong signal. The hand held monitor has taken a beating and still works fine. I think that this monitor is great for what it is....A baby monitor. Could this monitor be better? maybe, but you would be paying a lot more for it. Most likely any additional features would be overkill.

Reviews.Title: My favorite "baby" purchase!
Reviews.Author: Damar Earl
Reviews.Content: I love it!  Being able to see my grand daughter when she is taking her naps, not just listen for crying is fantastic!  I can see when she is stirring and awake long before she starts to cry.  It was so simple to set up, and is both helpful and fun. Even in a dark room, I can still see her.  Some reviewers have said the picture quality is not good enough... but it has been fine for me.  I didn't expect movie quality... I just want to see when she is stirring or sleeping soundly.  Great product.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Choice
Reviews.Author: Claudia de Lozano
Reviews.Content: I am so happy I chose this baby monitor. It is easy to install and easy to use. It has all necessary features a Baby Monitor should have (Compact, Affordable, Nice Resolution).

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: Pastor Richie
Reviews.Content: i was very pleased with the product. very easy to set up and use. we use it to monitor our older father. it's not practical to be in his room 24hrs a day, so this device gives us freedom. we can eat at the dinner table and enjoy a meal without concerns of him getting out of bed and maybe falling. this is very helpful !  thank you Jesus !

Reviews.Title: Great Product, BUT running on batteries is short-lived!
Reviews.Author: MamaBee
Reviews.Content: We love the product, and have used it since we moved our daughter into her crib in her own room at 2 months old. As she grew more mobile in her crib we realized we should probably move it from her crib (it was attached with crib mount, which is no longer available.) Once we needed to move the camera we thought we could use the battery powered feature since the shelf we wanted to place it on was not near an outlet. The camera soon lost power after just over an hour of being powered by batteries. We thought maybe it was the batteries, so the next night we replaced them with four new batteries, again, same problem, within an hour the camera was dead. Overall, it is really a GREAT product, just be sure you plan to use it plugged in, otherwise, it is not useful.

Reviews.Title: We loved it so much we just bought another one!!
Reviews.Author: AbbyB
Reviews.Content: We bought this monitor on faith originally from Costco online. I was surprised by how great it was because there really werent very many reviews about it at all. This product has litarlly saved me so many times. It is sooo reliable!! My son is now almost 16 months old and I just bought another one because it is finally dying after he has thrown it on the floor so many times. Honestly, I'm surprised it still works at all after what he put it through. (He's obsessed with anything electronic). We use the vox mode when we go to bed and it turns on when he wakes up or makes noises. It's got a nice sized color screen during the day and at night it has night vision. I can't say enough good things about this. It never has interference and we live in a condo with tons of other babies around. I have seen monitors that my friends have purchased for more money and their screens are way smaller and grainier. This is a superb quality product!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Monitor
Reviews.Author: Aleks
Reviews.Content: We have not tested this product out on the new born but my husband and I have tested it with each other and with our 3 year old daughter.  The image is crystal clear.  The first thing my husband said when he used the monitor was "WOW, this is sharp!! I wasn't expecting the picture to be this good."  The features on this monitor are amazing.  The camera acts as a camera, soothing music player and night light.  The camera has star lights that light up and are very pretty.  The music can be turned on from the hand held device so you don't have to go to the camera.  It has a choice of three classic babies songs.  The sound is also AWESOME!!!  Some reviews stated that this monitor was "too loud" with the sound.  I dont find that at all.  If it's too loud then turn down the volume.  I am confident to say that out of everything we have bought (and we have bought ALOT) this is by far the best spent money.  The monitor is great quality and retails for $299.99.  Of course we didn't spend that much but having it now and knowing the product I probably would have paid full retail price for it!!!Love it!!

Reviews.Title: Very happy so far
Reviews.Author: ali78
Reviews.Content: I ordered this monitor after returning a different video monitor which did not work at all.  I live in a condo and the first monitor we had was unsuccessful in getting a signal- I believe it was due to the fact that someone in a close proximity to us must have the same or similar monitor.Anyway, the Levana monitor has been great so far.  Super easy to set up and worked right away.  We have taken it on vacation and to relative's houses and it is very portable.  The attachment piece for the camera is a little awkward but we've managed to always find a place to fit it on to. My main complaints for the camera piece are the length of the power cord and the infared lights.  The cord is short so unless you want to use the battery-powered wireless option you need to have an outlet close to where the camera will be.  I've noticed that if the camera is more than 6 feet or so away from the baby the image is not the greatest.  The infared lights are bright and my daughter definitely was concerned with them the first few times we used this monitor.  She got used to them after a bit but some fussier sleepers may be bothered by them.The receiver is good- I haven't had any problem with accidentally turning on the music as some others have said.  The main complaint I have is that the lithium ion battery doesn't last too long.  It lasts through one night but needs to be charged daily.Overall I am very happy with this product.  It is far superior to the previous video monitor I had.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality product
Reviews.Author: Tyler Cooper
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift before our first baby. After 6 months, the power supply to the monitor broke. My brother also got one and in 8 months the volume to the monitor broke. When the product is working it is great, but it is hard to give a good review when you haven't seen it work for more then a year. The return service is tied up in red tape. After going through all the loops, they have found it defective and I hope they are returning it with a new one. However, I haven't received it yet.As a side note, you get a 1 year warranty with the product. You can get a 6 month extended warranty if you post a positive review of the product or a 1 year extended warranty if you post a positive video review of the product. Therefore, I would take that in consideration when looking at the reviews.

Reviews.Title: Some highs, but more lows!
Reviews.Author: Drilldoctor13
Reviews.Content: I bought this monitor for our first born a little over a year ago after a lot of research. When we first got it I was totally happy with it, but after about 6 months started having problems with it. First was the monitor started going off for no reason in the middle of the night saying "out of range", then the power cord stopped working, so we called customer service. HORRIBLE!! We tried their "web chat" but no one was there. Tried calling, and no answer, so we left messages and no return calls. After the second week of calling and leaving messages we got a call back, but the person I spoke with said they couldn't answer our question because he was a part of an overflow call back service. All he could do is relay the question to the company, well it took Levana another 2 weeks to call us back. The customer service that they claim is available "24 hours" is a bunch of bull. If I could give customer service negative 5 stars I would! After getting a new power cord, our other power cord went out as well! Needless to say, I didn't want to go through customer service again to get another one.

Reviews.Title: waste of money!
Reviews.Author: new mom
Reviews.Content: This monitor didn't work from day one, it's junk. The mount didn't hold the camera properly. There was horrible interference. We called the customer service number, we were on hold for 50 minutes waiting to talk to someone! Then when we did talk to someone it was a joke. He actually suggested we tape the camera to the wall. Thank god for Amazon, they refunded our money.

Reviews.Title: This Camera didn't even last 3 monthes
Reviews.Author: Sammi
Reviews.Content: This Camera started having a lot of peeping noises like a radio frequceis and it would turn off and back on so it was waking up the baby, we had to put it a side and buy another one just 3 monthes from this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love this monitor!
Reviews.Author: Reviewer0205
Reviews.Content: We've had this monitor for about a week now and it's perfect so far.  We were supposed to get another monitor but by the time we were ready to purchase it was no longer available.  That was a blessing in disguise.  I cannot imagine that it could have been as good as this one.  It took seconds to operate once out of the box (taking it out of the box actually took longer).  The picture is very clear, color by daylight and vivid b/w at night.  The camera is easy to attach anywhere such as our baby's crib or sleeper.  I like the VOX option which allows us to have sound monitoring and turn off the video to save battery life until the baby makes a sound and it turns back on (although the monitor battery life is very good!).  The mic does not pick up every little gurgle or sound baby makes but when the baby starts crying it picks it up loud and clear. The handheld monitor is light and easy to carry around and stands anywhere.  We have reception all over our 2 story house and we've had no problem with interference.  In fact, I'm writing this review online with the monitor right next to me.  We were not sure we were going to get a video monitor but I'm so glad we did and even happier that we bought the Levana.

Reviews.Title: A MUST FOR SURE!
Reviews.Author: Megan A. Armstrong
Reviews.Content: Our little girl is 17 months old - and this is a life saver... we had just a basic baby monitor before we purchased this one and it was good - but sometimes you cant tell exactly why your baby is crying. Being able to see that shes just fussing because she is putting herself to sleep verses throwing her favorite stuffed animal over the side of the crib - is a great thing to be able to distinguish!!! I absolutely will never go without this baby monitor if we have another! Plus with the music control - you can shut it off so it doesnt run all night and with the "VOX" option - u arent kept up with the glowing screen at night - it only lights up if she makes a noise. We definitely recommend this to anyone who is looking for an affordable monitor with great quality! ITS AWESOME! :)

Reviews.Title: waste of money
Reviews.Author: ojsmom628
Reviews.Content: If I could I would give this product zero stars.  I received this as a gift.  We didn't use it for the first month of my daughters life.  She is now 6 months old. We have been using it for 5 months and the video started to freeze up and the only way to "fix" it was to turn the camera off and back on again.  Then about a week ago the handset unit would not connect correctly to the cord to be charged.  So now, I have a monitor that I can't charge and is completely useless.  I contacted the company's customer service and they said I could return it w/an original sales receipt.  Well, no one I know keeps a receipt from a gift given to someone several months ago.  I asked if there was anything we could do w/out a receipt, like pay for repairs and the only response I would get is, "You need an original sales receipt".  Customer service was very unhelpful.When the unit did work, the picture quality was not outstanding.  And the microphone only picked up the baby's voice if she was screaming.  I wasn't too impressed with it at first but I could live with it, when it worked!!STAY AWAY FROM THIS MONITOR.  Spend your money on something else.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected. Perfect size.
Reviews.Author: N4GIL
Reviews.Content: READ the description before buying this item.This is a very durable product that operates easily.You can pay more for a similiar product, however, you won't find one that works this well.There appears to be many other uses for this monitor(home security, elder care, pet surveillance, etc.).Wonderful product.  Thank you.

Reviews.Title: second time my daughter went to use her gift and it will not work?  Looking for mfg. # to contact~
Reviews.Author: vickie
Reviews.Content: Second time my daughter went to use this gift from me....and it will not work...how embarrasing...I am trying to find the mfg. phone number....any help? I bought it way early for a shower gift, so now it is not returnable...

Reviews.Title: the best video baby monitor for the price
Reviews.Author: menifeemom
Reviews.Content: I bought this baby monitor a few months ago and I absolutely love it, the baby sleeps soudly in his crib and so do I in my bed. I would highly recommend this monitor to any parent

Reviews.Title: Battery and customer service = junk
Reviews.Author: Frantz
Reviews.Content: I got this monitor as a gift at the baby shower in June but I didn't use it until october. Once I started using it, the monitor would not turn on unless it was plugged in after only 2 weeks. When I tried to contact Levana, I sent an e-mail but got no reply, called 3 times and was answered by voicemail over the course of a month. I finally got through on the live chat and was told unless I have the receipt I will have to pay $20 for a new battery and $10 for shipping even though I said it was a gift. All in all I think it's a horrible product and customer service is horrible.

Reviews.Title: Broke the 1st week we used it.
Reviews.Author: Laura, NJ
Reviews.Content: The camera broke the 1st week we used it.  The camera head lock was stripped so the camera would not hold in place.  Amazon was kind enough to return our money.  Going back to a Summer product.

Reviews.Title: Super-easy setup.  Works like it's supposed to.
Reviews.Author: D. HAGLAND
Reviews.Content: I spent a good amount of time checking reviews of various baby monitors before deciding on this one.  It's not the prettiest, but it has the best feature set and works flawlessly so who cares what it looks like, right?  The only additional feature I wish it had was two-way communication, but all the ones I found that had that had significant other features missing.  I would highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: learning7 "learning7"
Reviews.Content: First, I think you should read all the 1 star reviews because they are all the same, which reveals the true quality of this device. All the 5 star reviewers probably wrote their reviews right when they received the item.Because at first, it's great. It's a perfect, affordable monitor with good sound and image.But then the problems start. The receiver buzzes when plugged in, which is strange. Also, the receiver picture turns itself on whenever a car drives by the house.Those things were annoying, but manageable.However, we recently noticed it was emitting the obvious odor of an electrical fire. Research shows that another model from this company has been recalled because of overheating and internal fires. Our unit probably has the same problem.I was able to easily contact support but now have to ship it back to them at my expense to see if they admit a manufacturers warranty. If not, they want to repair it at $50/hour and asked me to authorize this. I am obviously shipping it to them without authorizing an additional charge. If they can't admit it's defective, they can keep it.

Reviews.Title: Mute feature should be optional
Reviews.Author: mousefan
Reviews.Content: We have to have a monitor since our bedroom is downstairs and the baby's is upstairs.This baby monitor does not have interference, as stated. The picture quality is good but very small. It does have a bit of a delay in the picture sometimes.The battery is fine, lasts about 3 hours. It loses signal sometimes, we don't know why this is.I hate the mute feature!If this feature were optional, the monitor would have earned 5 stars! What is the point of having a baby monitor if it is going to mute? For parents who want to monitor their baby, they want to hear it! Over time anyone learns to sleep though certain things, the garbage man, the neighbor's dog etc. You will also learn to sleep through the baby breathing, rolling over, etc. But if my child begins coughing or crying, the monitor "learns" that noise and then mutes it! There are many times in which a monitor is very useful. When children get older and have little friends to play with or get old enough to get up and use the potty at night. I want to be able to hear all of those important sounds.  Until I get to buy another Summer's brand, I will have to use this one.

Reviews.Title: Worked great for a while, then tanked.
Reviews.Author: Melissa Wlodarski
Reviews.Content: We used this product with no problems, for about 7 months.  It was great to be able to see the baby during the night and hear when she made a sound above a normal "snore" or "moan".  We were very happy with the VOX feature and the screen quality was decent.  We had no problems with the unit until about 7 months into using it.During the night, we suddenly heard a loud screeching from the handheld unit (this wasn't audible in the baby's room, thank goodness).  The screeching never went away (to this day!) so we are stuck with a unit that we can't use the volume on.  Now, we turn the monitor on, but we keep the volume off...so we can see her, but we can't hear her because of the loud screeching.Levana offered to take the unit and test it in their facility, if we were still within a year of purchasing it.  Unfortunately for us, we had the unit for about 6 months before we started using it, so we were about a month past the year warranty.Looks like the company would have stood behind the product if we were within our year, so kudos to them for that.  Up until this happened, I highly recommended this product, but now I'm not so sure I can.

Reviews.Title: Not the best
Reviews.Author: John A. Ruskin
Reviews.Content: I was using it with the clamp on the edge of the co-sleeper and found the neck of the camera doesn't tighten well, so I'd have to kind of mess with it for a while to get it right.  Not the best with a sleeping baby.  Also, the cord itself has a very heavy part and so it made it even more difficult to angle the camera.  Finally 6 months in the cord lost its connection and now I have to see if the company will replace it.  Its also a pretty heavy unit so not the easiest for traveling.  I found just from one room away the monitor lost signal often- if near a computer or if we used the microwave.  Not a huge deal, just very annoying.  Overall, not thrilled with the quality of this product!

Reviews.Title: Video Monitor
Reviews.Author: efamily
Reviews.Content: Works very well. Image is very clear, with good color. I use it to keep an eye on the kids while they're sleeping upstairs, and during the night. Image very easy to see even when child sleeps in the dark. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Worst baby product ever!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: PDXnewdad
Reviews.Content: This is the lowest grade piece of junk on the market! I sent it back twice only to twice receive a remanufactored one back. The replacement unit hummed like a 1940's transistor radio. Please don't buy!

Reviews.Title: Great monitor
Reviews.Author: M. Ondrejcak "parents"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this monitor to keep eye on our almost 2 years old  daughter, so we don't have to run to check on her every time she makes some noise.It is great monitor. It works without any problem in are narrow and long apartment. She sleeps on one and and we are on other. Signal is strong even outside.We take it with us when we travel and it is easy to set it up in minute. Both magnetic stand and bracket are very useful. Battery in monitor last for long time after it is charged and option to put AA batteries in camera was useful for us when we went camping. We also used it recently in Europe when we went for vacation because it works with 240V as well. Can't say enough good things about this monitor. Picture quality is great even if room is totally dark. Option to have light on and music is also great when we travel. 5 stars all the way.

Reviews.Title: Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Kevin Mineard
Reviews.Content: This is a nice monitor and much better than the Summer brand that we bought with our first child.  The only complaint about this monitbr is that the handheld monitor losses its connection to the base unit and is difficult to reconnect.  But overall we love the fact that the unit has a sleep mode on it and has the ability to play music.Happy New ParentsKevin and Kristie

Reviews.Title: disappointing
Reviews.Author: Boogaloo "Boogaloo"
Reviews.Content: The first night back from the hospital with baby and the audio stopped working middle of the night so I woke up to my baby screaming across the hall as we clearly had not heard her earlier cues since the audio had stopped working. It basically went in and out of sound. In addition the monitor had permanent static. I assumed this would be a standard problem with all monitors but we subsequently purchased the Summer and it works perfectly and has a better picture...

Reviews.Title: Great video, high quality, sound is only weakness
Reviews.Author: Josh T. Beckham
Reviews.Content: The only problem we had with this monitor was that it does not pick up really low level sound from our newborn. But it would be great for an older baby that is past their SIDS window. Video is really good.

Reviews.Title: Good but not great
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: The pro's: Virtually no setup required, intuitive operation, night vision.  The con's: LCD viewing angle is poor, wireless range isn't great, sound level is too low and doesn't catch lower level sounds.The product comes pre-configured so its easy to setup and start using right away.  It has several nice features like night vision and lullaby music.  The sound level is too low, so if you are a deep sleeper it won't wake you.  Also, the sound isn't always on, its shuts off until a noise is heard.  This feature? makes it difficult to hear faint sounds or rustling. The wireless range wasn't great and would say out of range in a couple spots in my house. If I gripped the LCD unit near the antenna, range was drastically reduced.  The LCD is difficult to see unless you view directly straight on. The LCD viewing angle is maybe +/- 25 degrees on both up/down and sideways.In short, I am thinking of purchasing another brand cause of the problems above.

Reviews.Title: Worth every dollar!!!! The best monitor you can buy !!!!
Reviews.Author: Mauricio De Stefano
Reviews.Content: Since day one, this baby monitor added quality life in my house. The quality materials are great, the monitor definition is what you can expect, the range is very good, and the Lullaby music is very helpful. Now I can make sure my baby is ok during night and while playing. This is a must have item in babies room!!!! 100% recommended

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality, Vox rocks. But static sound could be bad
Reviews.Author: C. Zheng "ivorylily"
Reviews.Content: Now we've had this gadget for nearly 6 months, I can write a pretty informative review on this product.First of all, if you can't decide between the Summer Infant over this one, there is only one major determination factor to influence your decision: Do you live in a neighborhood with lots of babies around you? If the answer is yes, then you are better off going with this one. If not, Summer Infant might be adequate. The reason being digital vs analog. This device is digital so nobody will pick up your signal. Summer Infant is analog, so if your neighbor has one, they might pick up your imagesOk, now to the pros and cons of this product.Pros:1.Picture quality is awesome. Even at night, I can clearly see what my baby is doing. During the day, the color is very vivid. Don't expect to see color at night. There is no color without lights2. Vox feature is great. We usually leave Vox on all night. So the screen is dark. If she cries and the sound exceeds certain level, the picture pops up and you will know she is awake. Another nice thing is that if you have the soothing toy nearby that makes sound, like the music played by her mobile and the sleep sheep's sound, it won't trigger it. I absolutely love this feature3. Battery life is somewhat decent. I had it on Vox without plugging in all night, the handheld device is still going in the morning4. I love the camera setting. It's a magnetic base so you simple put the ball shaped monitor on top of it and rotate around to adjust the angel. It also has an adapter to hook it up on any crib. No screw required5. you can remotely turn on the music played by the monitor by using the handheld. It's nice to have when you need a few extra minutes before you can get to the baby and let the music sooth her. We don't use it often though.6. Single best feature: nobody can pick up your images!Cons:1. Static noise can drive you crazy if you keep the picture on all time. Because it's so loud, the static usually is the sound to wake me up, not the baby's cry next door, so I can't say it's all bad2. The sound of it is OK. It's not too crystal clear. Sometimes I can't tell if the baby is crying or just cooing to herself3.This is the biggest drawback as a digital device: when this thing is on, it shuts down our Netbook's wireless receiver. I don't know why, but my netbook's internet connection will be killed instantly. However, it does not bother our full size laptop nor the Mac mini, just the stupid netbook.Over all, it's a great little device. I won't pay $300 for it, but for little less than $150, it's worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: 2 thumps up
Reviews.Author: Charlotte
Reviews.Content: I purchase this after doing a lot of search. I went to Wal-Mart, Target, babies r us and online. So far this is the best price w/ free shipping.  Received this monitor in great condition.Option that I like: Small, portable, color screen, music option, Lithium rechargeable batteries.I would definitely recommend it. It is a great item for good price.

Reviews.Title: Overall, a good monitor
Reviews.Author: Eva Herrera
Reviews.Content: I received this monitor as a baby gift, and so far we've been pretty pleased with it.  The best feature is its portability.  Since our baby is not yet sleeping in a crib, we don't have any need to mount the camera.  We use the magnetic base and just move it wherever we happen to need it -- the bed, the floor, etc.  We even travel with it.  The range on the monitor is also good -- I've been able to walk to the mailbox and back (around the corner from my house) without losing the signal.  We have not had any issues with picture quality or buzzing like other reviewers mentioned, so I'm happy about that.So far my only complaint is that from time to time, the monitor (for no apparent reason) switches to "Out of Range" for a second, then goes back to the image, and it goes back and forth doing this for quite some time.  I know it's not a battery issue since it does this even when the monitor is plugged in.  I've contacted Levana's customer support and am hopeful they can resolve this for me, since I've been very happy with this product to date.

Reviews.Title: It works pretty well
Reviews.Author: Angela V.
Reviews.Content: This monitor works well for a visual, however the sound is not constantly functioning until our baby cries or makes a loud noise. We have been using a sound monitor as a backup for that reason. The monitor is great otherwise for watching the baby and giving us peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: Good unit for the price
Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: After looking at several monitors I picked the this one,I'm a grandparent and set for the babies a lot.This unit gives us very good view and sound when they are napping.There are a couple of set backs from the monitor I don't care for and that is that the voice activation is not so you can choose to have it on or voice activated, just the sound activation. This makes us uneasy because we are not sure if it is working properly or not. Sleeping light is normal with babies around, so we like to hear all sounds coming from the sleeping areas. Also it would be nice if the camera could be rotated from the base, we set for our two year old grandson and sometimes he get out of the cameras view. Beside that we really like the monitor and would recommend it. This would also work well with the elderly.

Reviews.Title: Its a great video monitor!
Reviews.Author: M. Shah
Reviews.Content: The only issue I have with it is, although they say it is interference free, it seems to interfere with our wireless connection and cell phone.  Otherwise, really good - love the lullaby feature.  I would not have my baby sleep in his room if not for this monitor.

Reviews.Title: NOT 'Interference Free'
Reviews.Author: MamaBear "mechanical engineer"
Reviews.Content: Got this as a gift at our babyshower and I was excited to use it with our new baby. Unfortunately it did not live up to our expectations. It has constant interference problems with our WiFi!! Because of this we do not have any audio and can not use the Vox feature that turns the monitor ON when the baby cries. The only reason it received any stars is because the remote lullaby feature has proved to be handy and the video quality is decent. I wish that we had registered for a different monitor. We will be trying to return it to the manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: Great price for a Great product!!
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: I bought this only based on reviews. I am happy to say I am NOT disappointed at all. This product has a great image that is very clear. I was  concerned at first with the reviews about the inability to pick up 'low' sounds coming from your baby. It does take the level of a normal conversation to activate the VOX but to get a descent nights sleep and not be woken by every little sound made by our son, I am fine with it. The set up and mounting is very easy. This product will not disappoint you at all!!!

Reviews.Title: Great monitor but wished picked up sound better
Reviews.Author: lethall12
Reviews.Content: Great monitor but wished picked up sound better.  There are some cases where we heard the baby and the monitor did not even pick it up.

Reviews.Title: Its a Good monitor, happy with the purchase
Reviews.Author: Chacko
Reviews.Content: I'm giving overall 4 stars even though there are a few drawbacks. Video quality(color) is not that great, night view is much better than the day view. can't check the battery status. The power adapter cable got a capacitor at the end where the camera is plugged to, minimize the portability. Sound quality is good but volume is too low. Overall i like this product. Its better to buy video monitor rather than an audio monitor, gives u peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: Love this monitor
Reviews.Author: Kristen Sauter
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this monitor. Being able to see our baby while napping is great. She is now getting to the age where she is starting to pull up and climb. Often she does this silently, so keeping an eye on her is such a relief. When the monitor is in AUX it turns on only when there is noise or movement, which is a great feature. The only downfall is that sometimes it doesn't catch movement. For the most part it does and it works well. The sound quality isn't great, but it gets the job done. This product is great! A great item for the price.

Reviews.Title: I couldn't live without it, but so many flaws
Reviews.Author: Grant Kindrick
Reviews.Content: A video monitor comes in so handy but I guess I bought the wrong one. The lights on the hand set and the camera are obnoxiously bright at night -- I had to cover both with tape. The camera mount is cheap and fails to stay in place. The button to play music (stupid feature) on the handset accidentally get pushed all the time, waking the baby. There is no sensitivity control so our white noise machine in the nursery sets off the monitor constantly.

Reviews.Title: Worked Great... for about three months.
Reviews.Author: MiddleAgedReviewer "M_A_R"
Reviews.Content: Before you purchase this product, please look at the updates other reviewers have added to their initial review.  I was coming back to update my review, but realized the review I'd written was actually for the monitor I'd purchased to replace this one.At first, this video baby monitor was awesome.  My wife and I would bring the monitor upstairs so that we could watch television for a little while before we went to bed, and we always ended up just watching our son over the monitor instead.  The night vision was not bad for low-light, and when our son took daytime naps, the color picture was very good.  The sound was good quality, and we liked that we could turn a few lullabyes on and off from upstairs.  The range was also very good.But.When we went to visit some family about two and a half months after buying the monitor, we set it up and I realized about half an hour later that the picture looked as if it hadn't changed at all.  I went to go check on my son (the room we were stayign in was on the other side of the house), and he was crying miserably.  You'd never know by the picture frozen on the screen!We tried repeatedly to use the monitor after that day, but it never worked well again.  After reading several other reviews here, it seems as if the same thing happened to several other consumers.  For well over $100, this unit should be working as well as it did at first for several years, not 75 days.  We were (and remain) very disappointed with the product.I give the BABYVIEW20 two stars, but only because it has such great potential; it worked great at first.  But in no way would I recommend anyone purchasing this product.  It's just poor quality, and is now a baby toy for my 16-month old.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Nicole Bouvier
Reviews.Content: I recently purchaed this monitor after a month of research.  This seems to be the best quality at a modest price.  I love the picture, very clear and good size screen.  The remote controlled lullaby feature is genius!  Mounting was very easy, and I have tried to access the camera from all areas in my home and the picture is excellent.  No interferance indeed!!

Reviews.Title: I love this product!
Reviews.Author: Sixponies
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this monitor!  It makes nap and night time so much easier as i can now "see" my baby when she is making noise...it really helps prevent me waking her up when all she is doing is making noises in her sleep.  I would highly recommend this monitor.  It was super easy to set up and the battery life is great.

Reviews.Title: Good for video, not so much for audio
Reviews.Author: C. Manawadu
Reviews.Content: We bought this after quite a bit of reading/comparisons on Amazon, and were happy with it initially after testing it. However, once the baby arrived we hit some practical issues with the monitor which made me request a return/refund from Amazon today. This was after using the unit for 4 days.The good: video is decent, and the unit is pretty easy to setup and get going.The bad: Audio monitoring is almost non-existent. It does not pickup the sounds you would expect to hear from an infant. Naturally, you would expect the sound to be the primary channel for "monitoring" your baby, and you'd rely on the video to check up on him/her once you hear something. Not quite. With this monitor, you'll need to keep your eyes firmly fixed on the monitor to see what's going on. Defeats the whole purpose for us.

Reviews.Title: So sorry this monitor didn't work for us...
Reviews.Author: Vdubb
Reviews.Content: I just had to write something. When this monitor works, it's great, unfortunately not the case for us.  The night vision is much higher quality than most, Iv'e personally have tried four others including this one.  A major issue with the first Levana was sound( none), the screen cutting in and out, and black and white picture during the day.  I was told it was defective, so I had high hopes for my second one, well that kept dropping the signal from the camera, it does alert you that this is happening with a sound which is annoying at 2 am! I have given up on Levana after two, also the auto mute was not for me, I like to hear my baby.  Good luck shoppers, hope this helps.P.S. Amazon customer service was awesome in helping me with my monitor drama.  I have the Summer Sleek n Secure now, it's ok ,night vision horrible, but walkie-talkie feature cool.

Reviews.Title: Very Unhappy...Misleading
Reviews.Author: 4Bruces
Reviews.Content: When I received my Baby View monitor I was very pleased with the look and video quality. At the time I was still pregnant and hadn't actually put it to use. When the time finally came that I was going to put my daughter in her own bedroom my husband and I set the camera up and laid my daughter down. She went to sleep perfectly, then to my suprise I realized I could no longer hear the quiet sound of her breathing. I thought maybe we had it on the wrong setting. It was almost like it was in the VOX mode but still showed the video. My husband and I read the manuel front to back and played with all of the buttons, finally I called the customer service line. They were very nice and said that there must be a problem with it and that someone would call me back in the morning, as it was 10:30pm by this time. The next day a women called me back from the company telling me that this is the way the monitor is supposed to function. The sound turns off until it detects a loud noise so that you do not get a lot of annoying background noise. I do not mind hearing some minor background noise to be able to roll over and hear my daughter breathing in the middle of the night. I am very unhappy with this product. This detail is not mentioned in any of the product info or in the manuel. If I would have known this I would have never considered buying this monitor.

Reviews.Title: Good little monitor for the price
Reviews.Author: Danger
Reviews.Content: This monitor is an acceptable device for our needs.  It's not perfect, but it didn't cost a bundle either.  The picture is good.  The screen is large enough to see detail.  I can see my baby breathing when attached to the crib side.  The screen could stand to dim more for night time use in our bedroom, it's at least as bright as a night light & usually right next to your face, so that could be a problem for some people.  The VOX option doesn't turn on at quiet enough noises, so we don't bother with it.  The battery life after 8 months of use is still +4 hours.  The volume will come on throughout the time it's running, making strange shifts from no sound to a white noise sound.  About half of the time, this is due to an actual noise.  It's durable, I drop it weekly & though the antenna cover broke once, I was able to fit it back on without it continuing to fall off all the time.  The distance that it gets the camera's signal seems to have shrunk a small amount.  I can still be two floors away & have a good signal but more than 15 feet outside of our house & I lose it.  I used to be able to go further out into our yard.  Also, there does seem to be some interference with our dual-band wireless internet connection if near a computer that is using it, it may cut out or run slow but not always.  Really though, this is a good product, like I said, for the money.  I'll buy another one if someone would tell me if two can run in the same house without interfering with each other.

Reviews.Title: Great monitor!!
Reviews.Author: New Mama
Reviews.Content: We bought this monitor after reviewing/researching several brands!  Love this monitor!!!!  Quit looking...buy this one!

Reviews.Title: Good video Monitor
Reviews.Author: The Federalist "The Federalist"
Reviews.Content: Works great, have wireless phones and a wi-fi network hub that is between the camera and monitor and it work's w/o interference. Sound works good, and turning on the lullaby remotely is a good tool to use. Don't like that the audio cuts off if there is minimal sound. The whole unit goes mute until a sound is loud enough to trigger it and with the delay of the speaker kicking in, who knows what audio source actually tripped the speaker. Speaker isn't loud, keep that in mind for the hearing impaired. A lot of the audio-only devices are LOUD, this one...not so much.We've had this thing for about a month, works like a champ. Keep in mind the decreased audio may be because we have the camera kinda far away to get a wide angle. We bought this for the "big girl bed" in the event she got up and around the safety bar.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: SFmom
Reviews.Content: I bought this monitor because of the great reviews and am very disappointed.  The video feature is great, I like the added music feature and the battery life is great HOWEVER - the audio quality is TERRIBLE.  My son is 3 weeks old and still sleeping in our room so it hasn't been a huge issue, but unless he's blue in the face screaming, the audio monitor won't pick it up.  If he's down for a nap during the day, my first indication that he's awake is that I can see him moving in the video and his mouth is open or I can hear him down the hall (but not on the monitor).  When it does pick up sound it goes in and out and doesn't hold the sound.  I can't put him to sleep in his room overnight b/c I'm worried I won't hear him until he's hysterical...I haven't tried to return this yet, but i hope amazon makes it an easy process.

Reviews.Title: We can see our crazy baby is safe!
Reviews.Author: J. Jones
Reviews.Content: We got this monitor for 2 reasons:-Our cheap, annoying analog monitor died-Our 11 month old can get out of the crib, and goes crazy trying to do so.This monitor is great!  I can't believe we didn't go digital sooner.  No more static and no more hearing the neighbor's baby on our monitor!Here are the wonderful things about this monitor:-Great picture.  Anyone on here who says it's terrible must have been expecting HD TV quality from a wireless device.  I can see my baby's chest going up and down as he sleeps.  And I can definitely see when I need to run in the room because he's about to fly out of the crib!  Some have also complained about the picture turning on and off.  That seems to only happen on the VOX setting between fusses.  As it should on that setting...-Night vision-works very well!-VOX.  Some seem to have sensitivity problems, but ours lights right up when he fusses.-Belt clip that can also flip to be a stand to keep the monitor upright.Here are a couple downsides:-The button that plays the lullaby is on the side and may be easily accidentally pressed.  I know the day I do that, I'll wake up my baby!-The camera has no zoom features.  I would like to be able to zoom out further so finding a mounting place is easier.  And, of course, zooming in would be nice to check breathing easier, etc.Overall, I love the product!  I can see my kid is safe.  No more legs stuck in the slats!  I would not pay the full price, however.  It is well worth the sale price.

Reviews.Title: Great product....initially
Reviews.Author: carlton191
Reviews.Content: After seeing first hand the un-usable picture/sound quality of the major manufacturers I began pouring through hundreds of reviews of all the top baby monitors on the market, and stumbled upon the Levana.  It had everything we needed, D/N, color, good range, music, and digital.  Also seemed to have substantially less interference issues than almost every other monitor.  We purchased this camera 2 weeks before our baby arrived and everything was going great until she was 6mos. old.  The only initial complaint was that there was a constant humming of the video, which was tolerable.  When our daughter was 6mos. old, the unit all of a sudden started to make and extremely LOUD hissing noise and then stopped working all together.  Not having the receipt, Levana refused to warranty the product, so I ended up having to go buy another unit, chalking the situation up to my fault for not saving the receipt.  The second unit's quality was terrible, very loud hissing, would enable the microphone for no reason, the picture quality was marginal at best and the music was not remotely switchable.  I ended up returning the unit all together and will be trying out the Mobicam digital.  I would NOT recommend this product based on quality control issues, and the company's unwillingness to immediately stand behind their product.

Reviews.Title: Good buy for the money
Reviews.Author: Shopping King
Reviews.Content: I  wish the cord was longer. I do like that the receiver holds a charge and doesn't need to stay plugged in. I mainly use this monitor for travel. I take it with me when visiting relatives. This monitor works fine, but it has some features that I'm not thrilled about. The ball camera is not attached to the base (it's magnetic). It stays on ok, but it can fall and roll away when you carry or adjust it. It doesn't function very well on a high shelf (like I have in my baby's room) because I can't angle the camera down enough to see the entire crib. Also, on the receiver, there is a button that turns on music in the baby's room! Needless to say, this has accidentally been pushed by myself and babysitters, waking the baby before we realize it.

Reviews.Title: Great Monitor
Reviews.Author: C. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Great product! I am satisfied with the quality of the picture and sound.  I love the mode where it only comes on when movement is detected.  Have not used it full time because the baby isn't here yet, but I have tested it multiple times with my husband and guests as they come to see the baby room.  Very easy to operate, didn't even open the manual.  So glad I bought this monitor, would definitely recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: Great device, very worth the money
Reviews.Author: James Cox "Jimc"
Reviews.Content: I bought this thinking it might do what I needed but it turned out to exceed my expectations.  The most impressive thing was the range over which it worked.  I live in an old house with plaster walls.  Inside those walls is chicken wire which was used as a framework for the plaster.  The chicken wire acts as radio signal dampener and I've had trouble getting even the best cordless phones to work in my house.  This thing was working everywhere!  I wish I knew what technology their using.Bottom line, buy it, it's great.

Reviews.Title: Very usefull
Reviews.Author: Alejandro Pena
Reviews.Content: Very useful and easy to use, no problem with the coordination between the camera and the interface.Good product i recomend it.

Reviews.Title: Low sound sensitivity
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The device is internally set to average conversation noise level (factory defined with no option for adjustment), which in some cases is too high for a newborn baby or for rooms that have higher noise level due a street for example, turning the device useless in the mode VOX, requiring too much attention or presence in the baby room. Countless times I heard my baby crying and the device could not detect!The VOX mode mode would theorically allow you to put the monitor in stand by mode (image off) and depending on the baby activity, it would turn on... Ideal for battery saving while sleeping.Now that my baby is 2 months old, it's become more accurate, and more safer, but still have problems with the sound sensibility.I don't know about other monitors, or if is there one that you can set/calibrate sensibility, but this one seems to fit to older babies (1 year or more...)Very good Night Mode, regular lens, but the average grade for the image is about 4 of 5 stars...Would NOT buy it again without knowing if other monitors have the same issue related to sensibility.Would NOT change it for a "Sound only monitor" (even if more sensible), because of image and night mode.

Reviews.Title: Good monitor!
Reviews.Author: Heidi "Heidi"
Reviews.Content: We have used this product every day, for 5 1/2 months now.  We have had no problems at all!  It is very easily moved, we love that it has a camera.  It has not had any interference or sound problems.  Great product, and have recommended to friends.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: Sara Reed "PAZOLDY"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a product that worked well for night vision. After reading many reviews, I decided on this product.  It worked perfectly for the time that I needed it and have now passed it on to a friend!  I would highly recommend this item.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Karla Duran
Reviews.Content: Im very happy with my purchase, and if I may say so, alot better than the past SUMMER INFANT I had.

Reviews.Title: Not quite the thing for me
Reviews.Author: WSwendy
Reviews.Content: I'm glad I didn't get rid of my old 'first years' monitor system -- I just hooked it up again and will set this one aside.  There may be times when I want to use it again, but so far it's failed me twice when it mattered.I primarily have dogs that I need to hear -- one especially has a problem sometimes and needs to be let outside.  Again this morning, I heard nothing over the Levana, which WAS working properly.  It just isn't strong enough, I guess.  Doesn't always pick up my dog barking.It's not entirely bad -- I can use it at times.  It was nice to have a video monitor, not just the audio.  The vox feature, at least theoretically, is good, so that there can be quiet in between noise.If left fully on, not using the vox feature, there is a humming sound that I find irritating.Privacy is probably more secure with the Levana, less with my old monitor, but -- well, if my neighbors want to sit and listen to my dogs bark every so often, they should really 'get a life!'There will be times when the Levana is more useful to me -- primarily because of the vox feature.  (My old system, now back in use, doesn't have that.)  But, for the most part, it's too weak of a system for my use.

Reviews.Title: Love this monitor!
Reviews.Author: S. Andonov "czarina"
Reviews.Content: I'm a worry wart first time mom and this monitor has totally made me fee at ease. The picture is great, the sound was perfect, mobility is awesome. I honestly don't understand the negative reviews. We have loved this monitor and for the price, you can't beat it! I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Excellent baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Ju
Reviews.Content: The product feels well built, design is cute & baby friendly. I especially love the clarity of the voice monitor and the night vision feature.

Reviews.Title: Amazing- much better than expected!
Reviews.Author: C. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I usually don't write reviews for things, unless I think they really go above and beyond.  This is one such item.  We looked around for a baby monitor to register for, and we chose this one since the features sounded interesting and I liked the idea of a video monitor.  We just got it from my shower and I have to say- both my husband and I can't believe how great this monitor is- we were both shocked.  The night vision is amazing.  I wasn't really expecting much with the night vision, but it works amazingly- even in a pitch black room!  I really can't recommend this product more highly- it's the best baby monitor I've ever seen.  A+

Reviews.Title: we rest easy
Reviews.Author: Amber M. Judd "New Mom"
Reviews.Content: We love the monitor!  The picture is great, if only I would stop watching it and sleep more!! The sound option allows us to get better sleep, but we feel confident in its ability to turn on when necessary.

Reviews.Title: This monitor changed my life ...
Reviews.Author: sweetaugust
Reviews.Content: I bought this monitor almost a month ago, and it has changed my life. I researched video monitors for weeks looking for one that was safe and reliable with great picture quality and no feedback, and I hit the jackpot with the Levana BabyView20. I researched it on the web and found that I could watch a demo of the video quality here: [..]. When the monitor arrived, it was very easy to mount to the side of my son's pack n' play, and the video quality is clear enough that I can see my son's chest rise and fall as he's sleeping. As the mother of a child with unique medical needs, this was an extremely important feature. With the night vision, I can feel confident that he is breathing well without having to go into his room and possibly interrupt his sleep. I also love that I can turn music on remotely to calm him when he gets fussy, and the battery on the handheld monitor lasts for longer than his nap, which is anywhere from two to three hours. I also love that the audio only turns on when he makes noise or moves significantly, which is fantastic and really eliminates feedback. The buzzing is so minimal that I can sleep with it only a foot away and not hear it at all. Before getting this monitor, I went in my son's room anytime he made a noise because I wanted to be sure he was okay. This was completely detrimental to training him to sleep through the night, and we spent two years getting up a dozen times a night to check on him. Now we know exactly how he's doing in his room, and he's been sleeping through the night for nearly as long as we've had the monitor. Being able to see him and know that he's okay when he's crying has completely changed my life.

Reviews.Title: So far so good, I love it!
Reviews.Author: J. Wesel
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed this product thus far, we have not had a chance to test it out for very long, however the picture quality is great as is the sound quality. There is a slight delay in the sound, less than a second, but it is not a problem for us. I love the crispness in the picture you get, and I love being able to see my baby when he is sleeping, or resting. The one complaint that I have is that there is a slight buzzing noise on the handset when it is turned on, it is not really a problem, but it is a very minor annpyance. I know that some people have reported problems with the battery life and thus far we have not encountered these problems. We love the monitor and it is a purchace that I would make again in a moment.

Reviews.Title: YOU MUST OWN THIS WITH A NEWBORN
Reviews.Author: Andrew Veseth
Reviews.Content: If you've spent the night listening to the crackle and pop of an analog baby monitor then this camera is your savior.  After two weeks torture I bought this camera and although its pricey its worth double what you pay for it.  Crystal clear video and audio with two wireless routes, cell phones, cordless phones and all the other goodies that annoyed my old setup.  The first night we swapped to this camera was dead silent.  Do yourself a favor and buy this camera.  I know we will be using this for several years and the quality of both the camera and hand held are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Clear video and sound; interference free; best monitor for $
Reviews.Author: K. Keith "Keithtimes"
Reviews.Content: The Levana 2.4GHz monitor does exactly what a video monitor SHOULD do: Color video (for the price, it's not bad quality AT ALL; clear voice; voice activated (which saves battery); video turns on when it hears voice at night (again, saves battery); has good range (will explain later); and is simple to use.This was a replacement to our Sony BabyCall 900MHz. The 900MHz monitor picked up so much interference I felt like the kid in the Shyamalan movie, Signs, who picked up alien signals. The only thing worse that a crying baby waking me up in the middle of the night is the baby's monitor going off with bleeps and chirps, ugh!Things that set this monitor apart:-Ability to "Send" a song to the camera in the baby's room like Rockaby Baby-Night and Day camera capability. It automatically changes to InfraRed (or whatever it uses) when it's dark.-Portable, battery powered camera AND monitor (i.e. can be completely wireless) NOTE: Camera uses 4AAA and monitor is NiMh rechargeable-Comes with two stands for the camera (a fixed, crib mount and a temporary magnetic one for flat surfaces)-The belt clip for the monitor rotates around 180 degrees to be the monitor's stand: I love that simple and smart design feature.-Adequate range. We live in a two-story townhouse and we get a signal in the basement from the baby's room on the 2nd floor.Things I would change about product:-Improve the quality of the crib mount, not all cribs have right angles and the clamp is okay, but not ideal of every surface.-Lengthen the power cord for the monitor/camera, right now it's only about 4' long. Yes, I can get a $2 extension cord, but do I WANT to?Bottom line: This camera's competition is the $200-300 high-end baby monitors or home security systems. If you're like me and you want the best quality for the cheapest amount of money, this is it. It's not high-end, but man it WORKS.

Reviews.Title: Not perfect but close :)
Reviews.Author: Wojciech Socha
Reviews.Content: I've been using it for about a week now and I really like it so far. Image quality is great, the vox function works very well, it activates just after the baby starts making sounds but you can turn the volume down and just observe the green bar that "shows" you the sound volume if you want. For me the most important thing is to be able to see what the baby is doing just after I put her to sleep. In a dark room I can't see if she has her eyes closed or not but with the camera I can see it perfectly without disturbing her. For me it's a good indication to see if she is ready to seep or if she needs more settling.It's not perfect for two reasons. Both pretty common. The first one is the red light in the front that lights up whenever you turn the device on. I saw that most of the monitors have this kind of light and I can't understand why they can't put it at the back. The light is pretty strong in the dark and I was afraid it would disturb the baby so I opened the device and removed the light "gently". (requires a minimum of technical skills though)The second problem is the static. It's not too strong and it doesn't bother me but I was hoping the sound would be crystal clear. It's not.I recommend the device.

Reviews.Title: meets my need,exc. video,clear voice,good price
Reviews.Author: A. ALBOAINAIN
Reviews.Content: thaaaaaaaanx,the first word ill say.I live in Bahrain and i recived my items after 7 days only in thier excellent original condetion.the levana video baby monitor, :)- excellent clear video (colored video at day/ clear at night) & clear voice- no interferance- good signal (I went out to my backyard -for 2sec. i lost the signal but i press the VOX btn the signal come again-also I went to my first floor and my baby was in the ground one and still get good signal.- easy to use - you can use the power adapter for the cam. or you can use 4 AAA batt.- i need less than 3 hours to fully charged the battery of the monitor.- the cam. can be attached easly to the crib or on the base that comes with it.(see my pic.'s)*my 2 sisters will order for there babies  :)** highly recommended

Reviews.Title: The best by far!
Reviews.Author: Metra reader
Reviews.Content: Does not interfere with cell phone, internet, or pick up weird signals. Great quality product and not a bad price!

Reviews.Title: Static
Reviews.Author: Carl Anderson
Reviews.Content: Good/Fair image quality.  Work well in dark.  Audio quality isn't anywhere close to what we need.  The unit has difficulty picking up sounds.  Our baby really has to be yelling or screaming for the unit to kick on from standby mode.  In 'always' on mode we hear a lot of static.  Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: NOT PERFECT, BUT IS NEAR
Reviews.Author: Andres Pinilla "A.P."
Reviews.Content: It's fantactic, in only 3 mins is running. The only imperfection is on the sound, it is not always transmitted with the image.

Reviews.Title: Levana Babyview20 video monitor
Reviews.Author: Snazzy
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome monitor. Bought it after a recommendation by a friend.The camera is not wide angled so you do not see the entire crib if, you clamped it on the crib but just get until the waist and if the baby turns around, rolls around away from the camera's view you will need to go to the room to see where the baby is. I wish the camera was a little more wide angled.

Reviews.Title: ALMOST Perfect! A Must-Have!
Reviews.Author: P. SIMPSON
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were originally going to settle for an audio monitor, but then a friend of mine showed me hers and I realized how neat and useful they were. My friend has the Summer Infant Day & Night Handheld Color Video Monitor, but while I was shopping, I saw that this one has more features and doesn't cost that much more. We have used this for 3 months since my son moved out of the bassinet in our room to the crib in his nursery.This monitor was so easy to set up, I just took it out of the box and plugged it in. The screen is big and decent. Don't expect HD TV quality, it's more like a webcam picture. The night vision is great, but the daytime picture is gray looking, but still a clear image. The volume is more than loud enough and crystal clear and without interference. I like that the camera and parent unit have power adapters and the option to use batteries in both. Now on to my favorites of this nifty item! The voice-activated feature is awesome!!! At first I wasn't sure I'd like it because I wanted to keep the sound on and just turn on/off the video at will like my friend's video monitor, but now I'm glad the whole parent unit shuts off unless the baby makes a noise. I have never had problem with it not working and I actually find the vox feature quite sensitive to noise. I like the music feature, but don't like the fact that the sound and video on the parent unit stays on if you turn the music in the camera on.  The crib mount has been great because I get a close view of my baby, BUT now that my son rolls around, he partially moves in and out of view of the camera since the camera only covers about 80% of his crib (I placed it on the side of the crib at the very end, so only the 20% area closest to the camera is out of view). I know once he starts to pull himself up I will have to move the camera altogether or else he will be able to mess with it. It comes with a magnetic base that allows the camera to be manually turned and tilted for a better view, but no wall mount which would give the optimal view so I will have to put it on his dresser next to the crib. The camera doesn't pan or zoom. You also can't control the nightlight feature from the parent unit.None of the negative aspects of this baby monitor warrant losing a star in my opinion because you will not find a video monitor that has it all in this price range. Overall, it does what it claims and does it well. I highly recommend this video monitor to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Great video - only minor problems
Reviews.Author: S. Chiang "no_worries"
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a great video monitor.  The picture quality is nice.  What I find most handy is the standby mode for nighttime and the nightlight feature on the camera.I keep the monitor plugged in during the night, but in standby mode and the volume off.  My 4 month old daughter sleeps 10 hours through the night, but does wake occasionally.  In those cases, I find she will murmur and cry for a few minutes then puts herself back to sleep.  I'm a light sleeper, so I sound of the monitor switching out of standby mode is enough to wake me up.  There is a low buzz when the monitor is on that probably only I could hear.  As long as she's making noises, there's the buzz.  When it's quiet, it automatically goes back into standby.  I found this enough for me to know when she's awake without needing to hear the cries.At night, I turn on the nightlight and I think it's enough for her.  There are some red lights (I think for the nighttime image).  When we first installed the camera, she would stare mesmerized by the red light.  Now she's gotten used to it.  I don't use the remote lullaby feature too often.  My only complaint is that sometimes it will lose signal even when I'm a short distance away (less than 50 feet away).  The lost signal lasts only a second, before resuming again.  So it's a little annoying, but not a terrible inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: Piece of mind
Reviews.Author: Amelia Elena Jaime
Reviews.Content: We recently bought the Levana BABYVIEW20 and it has provided us with a great piece of mind keeping on an eye on our little one while we're in another room. The picture quality is great even at night and the red light seems to keep our little one occupied as well. The only thing that could use improvement is the sound. It sometimes fades in and out or only picks up his sounds at a certain pitch.

Reviews.Title: It is what i was looking for.
Reviews.Author: J. C.
Reviews.Content: Good, image and sound, range not tested yet, simple instructions. You can use it with the a/c adapter or batteries. It would be nice if batteries were included.

Reviews.Title: 1st time Mom likes this product
Reviews.Author: Jessica R
Reviews.Content: As a first time Mom currently living in a 2 story home, I like this product. When my husband first recommended getting it, I thought it was a bit much. Most of my friends have an audio monitor, which seems to work fine. We got it anyway, my husband loves gadgets, and I'm glad we did. I like being able to see our son, not just hear him. There are times he's laying awake yet not making noise. Then I know my free time is coming to a close and I can finish up what I'm doing. Also I was a bit nervous when he first came home, when it's too quite I get uncomfortable. Being able to see him helped me feel at ease.The only problem we've had with the product is the clamp, and customer service was very responsive and offered to send us a new one. I am not very technically oriented and this product is very intuitive to set up and use.Hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: Overall pleased, with a few noteworthy "snags"
Reviews.Author: R. Cates
Reviews.Content: This is not our 1st baby monitor.  We have a 2nd video monitor (the Summer video monitor) that we now use for our older child, so this a 2nd video monitor for our younger child.  Overall, we really enjoy the monitor a lot more than the Summer monitor.  Comparing the 2 monitors & including some general Pros/cons:+ Levana has a dramatically better picture, there is little to no static, the monitor doesn't get hot AT ALL when the video is on (unlike our other video monitor), excellent battery life, lightweight & easy to tote around. - Some "trouble" areas that we have found:  (1) the camera does in fact go out of range when we go outside, despite pictures/statements to the contrary. Does OK in the garage.  (2) The heavy plug-in cord that attaches to the device to dock/charge sometimes does not get fully connected, specifically if the heavy part of the cord is hanging off an end table, for example.  We realized this after we heard a high-pitched squeal that the unit emits before it runs out of battery (usually around 4am, ugh!)  (3) There are 2 video modes...on all the time or off until there is sound/movement at which time it flashes on.  The blinking on/off is very distracting for parents trying to sleep, so you are left with no other option to leave it on at all times.  We wish that it was like our other video monitor that you could choose to "listen" to the sound in the room with no video.

Reviews.Title: Not bad, but a couple major flaws.
Reviews.Author: J. Doi
Reviews.Content: We've been using this for about 3 months so far and it does help.  The concept of having a camera in the baby's room to keep an "eye" on them without having to go in, and possibly disturbing them, is great.Packaging:It arrived in the standard brown amazon box with air filled padding.  The actual product was in a compact box with the components nicely packed. It was relatively easy to remove with some tape and twist ties holding everything in place.  Contents:  1 x Camera  1 x AC Adapter for camers  1 x "Magnetic" mounting base for camera  1 x Clamp style mount for camera  1 x Receiver, color monitor  1 x AC Adapter for monitor  1 x ManualInitial Setup:Setting it up to do a test run was very easy.  Plug the AC adapters into the appropriate hardware and turn them on.  The manual says to sync them but they were working fine out of the box.  If you are going to run the camera on double A batteries, you will need a small Philips head screwdriver to get the back plate off.  I'm not sure the running time on batteries as I just leave it plugged in.  The rechargeable battery for the monitor wasn't charged so you will need to charge it if you plan to use it off AC power.  It charged in about 2 hours.Features:The camera has an on/off switch which is easy to operate. When on, there is a red light that turns on above the camera lens.  It's not too bright but it is noticeable.  Our baby tended to stare at it the first couple of nights.  It also has 3 stars along the top of it that will glow an orange color with the "night light" option turned on.  The switch for the night light is a button that is easy to turn on and off.The monitor has 5 buttons, volume scroller, status lights and the screen.  The buttons on the left hand side control the lullabies and the VOX option.  The right hand buttons control the brightness of the screen and the volume scroller controls the volume.  The lullabies are turned on/off by the upper left hand side button and the lullaby selection is handled by the button right below it.  The VOX options will only turn the monitor screen on when it registers a sound from the camera (ie. baby crying).  I guess this is used to save battery life, but in practice, doesn't work well at all (see cons for more info).  The brightness control lets you change the brightness of the display, which helps at night when you don't want the monitors display shining in your face.  It can get decently dim and very bright, however, the night vision pulses detract from the usefulness of the dimmer.  The status lights show you if the power is on, if you have a connection with the camera, if the lullabies are on, and if you are in VOX mode.  The power light will turn blue if it's charging, red if it's on battery, and flash red when it's low on battery life.  There is also a volume indicator which shows the volume of the sound being picked up by the camera.Day time use:Day time use is great.  The picture quality in color is nice, you can see baby without any issues.  I didn't get a chance to see how viewable the screen was outside in the direct sunlight, but inside it works great.Night time use:The camera automatically switches to "night vision" mode when the light gets too low for day color use.  The color screen display becomes more of a black & white w/ greenish tint.  It's easy enough to see baby at night.  As other reviewers have noted, the display pulses about every 6 seconds, which is annoying when you're trying to sleep yourself.Pros:+ Easy Setup+ Color monitor w/ night vision+ Rechargeable monitor battery+ Portable monitor+ Multiple mounting options for camera+ No interference from other sourcesCons:- Night vision mode monitor pulses every 6 seconds.- No volume adjustment for lullabies (it's very soft).- Receiver doesn't always pick up sounds.  I'm assuming it has a built in sound filter that is supposed to help eliminate background noise.  It works, but sometimes it doesn't pick up baby crying.  Also, if you're playing lullabies, it will occasionally pick up parts of the lullaby's sound.  It would be nice to be able to turn this feature off so that it picks up everything instead of random noises here and there.- VOX mode doesn't work well.  Probably because of the above.  It would randomly turn on at times from other sounds and sometimes wouldn't turn on when baby was crying.- AC adapter for the camera has a huge black cylinder located right before the plug into the camera.  When using the magnetic mounting base, this black thing tends to cause the camera to angle downward.  I think it's a filter to eliminate noise from the electrical signal, but it's so bulky it makes it hard to get a good angle on the camera.- Can interfere with other 2.4GHz wireless signals.  Occasionally my wireless internet gets knocked off because of this.Untested:= Range of unit.  I live in a small apartment so the max distance I could test was about 100ft through 2 drywalls. It was fine at this range.= Viewable in direct sunlight.= Durability over long usage period.Conclusion:Overall, it's a decent product.  Daytime use is great, but night time use is hampered by the constant pulsing of the monitor.  The sound pick up also needs to be improved.  In a small apartment, it's ok as I can still hear the baby from the room, but in a larger house, it might not be so good.  It did give us peace of mind that we could see the baby whenever we needed to without having to go into baby's room.  This was a great tool, especially when transitioning baby from the basinet to the crib.  We can check baby's sleep position, that baby is still breathing, and if baby is calming down.  If you can live with the 2 major flaws (pulsing and sound pick up), this is a good product.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Paulk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have really enjoyed using this product.  It was easy to set up and has very clear picture quality!

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!!
Reviews.Author: P. Fabian
Reviews.Content: We bought this monitor about a month ago. Our daughter is 3 months old. We researched monitors for a couple weeks before deciding on this one. We were very excited about getting a video monitor. We have a 7 year old son and there weren't video monitors when he was little. The night vision is amazing!!!! It is a crystal clear picture and not green like normal night vision. It is just black and white. The picture quality period on the monitor is wonderful. The colors are awesome. I love the VOX setting where the monitor is on but unless the baby is making noise the screen is off (but you can check on the baby anytime by pushing the button). Our daughter loves the music (that you can turn on from the monitor). If she wakes up and we are doing dishes or folding clothes she will lay there just listening to the music until we are done. If you are considering buying a video monitor you can't go wrong with this one. We are more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Joao L. Dasilva
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with the purchase of this product.  One of the things I worried the most was the picture, but it works just fine.  Also, I wanted to make sure that the signal worked fine, and I have had no problem so far and am being able to use it all over the house.  I believe this is just what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: nothing special
Reviews.Author: Nataly "Nataly"
Reviews.Content: The picture and sound quality is decent on this camera.  The main problem I have is the battery life.  It is definitely not enough to last through the whole night.  The camera unit has to be hooked up to the AC adapter most of the day and the monitor has to get recharged every 4 hours.  In order to get the monitor fully charged you have to let it charge for 3 hours. I would not recommend this monitor to anyone. Try to look for a monitor with a longer battery life.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Suryakant Sansare
Reviews.Content: I have been using this for 5 months now.. The picture quality is very good. I have only one minor problem with the sound. There is a considerable delay in the sound from when the baby cries to when you hear it on the handset. It also does not pick up any sound less than a cry (which may be a good thing for some folks :) . Other than that i have no issues.

Reviews.Title: Babyview is great.
Reviews.Author: Donutlady "Janet"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Babyview Moniter for my nephew and wife to use for the new daughter that will be born in February. When it arrived we tried it out on the pups in residence. We enjoyed the visuals and the sound was very relaxing to the pups. I am sure the new arrival will enjoy it and the parents will feel secure in knowing that the little one can be monitored and safe in the nursery.

Reviews.Title: OK product, but there are issues...
