Reviews.Author: Sharp Shopper "CC"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product in Aug 09, about a month in advance of my expected baby boy.  When I got it and set it up, I though it was great.  The video and sound qualities were good; there was no interference; and it installed quickly and effortlessly.  However, when my baby arrived a month later, I realized that there were other problems with this unit that I did not expect...First of all, the battery on the monitor died within a week, and did not hold a charge for very long subsequently.  Now I pretty much have to keep it plugged in all through the night since I will end up having to do it at some point anyway.Second, the sound cuts in and out.  At one point I saw my baby moving around and making faces, but heard no sound from the monitor.  When I went into his room to investigate, he was well awake and making whining noises.  If I had not been awake to see my son's movement, I would not have known that he was awake.Finally, and the biggest problem of all, on this side of the hand-held monitor are buttons that activate lullabies on the camera end in the baby's room.  From time to time while handling the monitor, your hand will hit a button that turns on the lullaby which wakes the baby up.  This became very frustrating after a while.  Now I have to be very cautious of how I hold the monitor so I don't press the buttons that turns on the lullaby.Overall, the product does its job and there are some very good qualities, such as the zero-interference and night vision optoins; however, the other annoying attributes of this product persuade me to not give it a recommendation.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely worth every penny!
Reviews.Author: Alexander Heyman "aheymanduke"
Reviews.Content: I have not written reviews for Amazon.com before now, but I felt compelled to write about this video monitor.  Quick background, we have a 14 year old daughter and an infant.  I thought my wife would be an Old Pro at this, not a New Mommy, but turns out 14 years is a long time to remember everything.  SO... the very nice audio-only monitor that we bought before the baby was born was great in theory, but in practice my wife went into the baby's room to check on her every 20 minutes or so during a nap and as often as every hour overnight.  Hence, she didn't sleep well, the baby didn't sleep well- NOT the ideal situation.Enter this video monitor.  I bought it on a Friday, paid the extra $7 for the Saturday delivery, and all of my wife's concerns were solved immediately.  The camera attaches to a bracket to mount on the crib, it plugs into the wall, and in less than 3 minutes we had it up and running with live video feed across the house.  The picture quality gets an A- in daylight and an A for its (very cool) night vision.  My wife can carry the monitor around the entire house, watch the baby any time she's sleeping, and it completely eases her mind to see the baby is safe.Only two things that aren't great:  1. The voice-activated function sometime doesn't pick up softer noises, so it can take a good squawk to turn the video on from the sleep mode.  #2.  It claims to be interference free, but we have found that using a computer or other Wi-Fi device within about 10 feet of the monitor tends to block the internet or slow it WAY down.  Easy fix, just move the monitor or turn it off for a few minutesOverall, it is a very economical solution to help calm a nervous new mother's nerves when the baby is sleeping in the other room, starting to roll over, etc.  This is not James Bond quality spy equipment, but it gets the job done very nicely and for a great price.  Highly recommend this item.

Reviews.Title: Love this monitor!
Reviews.Author: Owen
Reviews.Content: Our first monitor was audio only and it worked okay.  This monitor has far superior sound quality and has video as well.  We have a lot of gadgets in our house and have had no interference with this product.  Video works well especially the night vision; just don't expect it to be crystal clear like when you watch a HD football game.  Would like for it to have a zoom, but not too big of deal that it doesn't.  Battery life is pretty good, we leave it plugged in while we sleep but use the batteries while were up and around the house and haven't had it run out on us.  It also plays nursury songs, which I didn't think we'd use it much, but it's actually a pretty handy bonus feature.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with my purchase!
Reviews.Author: Mariana Theodoro
Reviews.Content: After trying out 4 different baby monitors, I'm really glad I found this one.  All the others had horrible interference or image (even some more expensive ones).  This monitor however has good image and I've never experienced any interference.  Very easy to set up.  It's also very portable, so great when you're traveling.  The battery life isn't very long, but so far it has satisfied our needs.  One time we had a little trouble with the handheld device not coming on in VOX mode when our baby was making just a little bit of noise, but this was fixed after reseting it with the actual monitor.  Also, I think the music on it is a little loud and I wish we had a way to control the volume, but overall I think this is a great buy and I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Bummed
Reviews.Author: R. M. Benedict
Reviews.Content: We used this product for approximately 10 days before the noise started.  We experienced what sounded like someone blowing into a microphone and it was a constant interruption.  We had to turn the volume down just so we could use the monitor at times because the noise was so loud. The issue was random and would last for different periods of time.We contacted Customer service and they recommended that we "re-sync" the product by holding down the VOX button on the monitor while holding down the light button on the camera until it blinked.  This did not help.  We also took it to a friends home to see if it the same issue happened there- it did.We are in the process of returning it to SVAT Electronics for "inspection" and have to pay the shipping back to them.  Not only do we have to do that, but we also have a turn around time of 2 to 4 weeks.  What are we supposed to do during that time? Sleep in the baby's room?  The SVAT website to respond to customer issues is not very good either- their form did not have a send option, only black boxes that one would assume would send the information.  So I just clicked on them until I got a reply.Unfortunately this entire process has taken away from the fact that I really enjoyed this monitor and that it worked very well those 10 days.  The only complaint I would have had would be the small humming noise that it makes when you leave the video on constantly.  The VOX (voice activated) feature works really well and helps to save on the battery life. The screen was very clear and the night vision was great!Guess we'll see how well it works when and if we get it back-  If they don't "find" the same issue, we have to pay them $50/per HOUR to test it!!! Insane I think- because how is one to PROVE there was an issue to begin with. I can only hope for the best.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware!
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Shea
Reviews.Content: Just got the Babyview20 today.  Hooked it up and it immediately made an interference noise...undaunted because I read so many good reviews I thought this will be an easy fix.  So I call tech support, turned off wifi router, other baby monitor, cordless phone etc. and nothing worked!  So I have to send the unit back AND I HAVE TO PAY FOR SHIPPING!  On top of that it will take up to 1 month!  Just thought you should know!

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous Design and Good Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: Decided on this wireless video monitor based on its look, design and price over other models. This seems to be the only one in the market that has a crib mount. The light powder green color looks gorgeous. And its price on amazon.com is below models from Babys'rus or BuyBuyBay.Bought this system to keep an eye on my new born baby. Set up the camera on the crib and turn on the monitor. Wana, it works. Image is good for its intended purpose, we're not talking about High Def system here. Night vision is really amazing. Remote-controlling the lulaby is great. The VOX function is practical (save battery power & screen burn-in) and works really well.One thing I did notice is when I turn off the monitor while keeping the camera on, the next time I turn on the monitor it could have a blank "white" screen (50/50 chance). I found the problem can be fixed by turning off the camera and turning it back on.A quick phone call next day to their 24x7 hotline provides excellent information on how to fix this "problem". The blank screen is caused by the monitor lost its wireless sync with the camera when it is off. One way to force a re-sync is by pressing the VOX button (monitor) and Light button (camera) simultaneously for several seconds until the light starts blinking. I tried the re-sync process and it works.

Reviews.Title: lots of interference, unreliable audio, useless customer service
Reviews.Author: jo
Reviews.Content: We like having a video monitor. It is easily installed/portable for visiting family, and the picture's good. The audio does not work as well; it sometimes comes in and out, and rarely works on low volumes. we basically can't use the audio feature at all. Frequently the screen goes white, which is annoying, but fixes itself if you switch the monitor off and on again. This wakes us up in the night frequently, or makes us jump thinking something's wrong. Lots of phone/microwave interference, despite how it is marketed. Customer service explained that we couldn't expect it to work in our single-family home with cordless phones! They said they would see if it needed repair, but WE have to pay to ship it to Canada and back, and it would take "2 to 4 weeks" for them to test it, which is not at all helpful (despite an extended warranty). We still use it because we have it, but do yourself a favor and buy a better version.

Reviews.Title: Very good product and seller (by Newthon)
Reviews.Author: N. GONCALVES "Miguelito"
Reviews.Content: This product is very usefull. I can see my baby when I have the sun light in the room and when it is in the darkness. The light surround the camera helps to find it in the darkness. An interesting feature is the button to put the monitor in stand-by, turning off the monitor light and sound and turning it on when the camera capture every sound or moviment. I read that some customer had problems in image got freeze or lost connection and other customers didn't have the same problem and I think it could be because the place they use it. So far i didn't had this kind of problems. All product have pros. and cons. but I think that this product is an intermediary between cost and beneficities

Reviews.Title: Works like a dream
Reviews.Author: Scott Petersen
Reviews.Content: We tried other video monitors, but no matter what the product, they all had problems with interference from wireless networks and phones.  The Levana Babyview20 worked perfect right out of the box with no interference and is dead simple to operate.An added bonus is that all the details are well thought out and executed.* The LCD monitor has a rechargeable LiIon battery so you can unplug and go anywhere within range and still stay in touch with your (hopefully) sleeping child.* The camera auto switches to night vision.  Other products require the user to flip a switch.* The camera comes with a mounting bracket that is useful and simple.* The audio sensitivity of the voice activated LCD monitoring seems to be just right (although being able to set it yourself would have been nice).* It's cute, much cuter in person than the pictures portray

Reviews.Title: Great CRIB monitor, not a great ROOM monitor
Reviews.Author: Sparky Jones
Reviews.Content: The short:  A well made, interference-free and SECURE video baby monitor ideal for close-up crib monitoring.  However, it lacks the audio sensitivity for covering an entire room.The long:  My wife and I sought a video monitor for watching our child who is now three years old.  As mentioned in my review of a different monitor (audio only), I value my privacy immensely.  Baby monitors, both audio and video models, are difficult to find in a digital broadcast format.  Most of them are analog.  This means that anyone with a baby monitor or scanner can pick up those frequencies and listen or WATCH.  Thanks, but I don't need my neighbors listening to my family conversations, let alone watching.  This monitor does not have that problem as it is digital.When the manufacturer says interference free, they mean it.  The video quality on this is superb.  No, it's not a ultra high quality camera.  However, it provides a very good color and black/white (night only) picture with no snow or noise.My main disappointment with this is that I assumed I could set the camera on a dresser and aim it down towards the bed.  This works great for the video, but not the audio.  The audio does not broadcast continuously (much to my wife's dismay).  It has a set 'sound level' which will turn on the audio transmitter and send it to the receiver.  Unfortunately, if the camera is more than 7-8 feet away, it won't hit that level unless the noise is very loud.That said, I moved the camera and clipped it to the headboard, about 3-4 feet from my child's head... about what it would be on a crib.  It worked great after that.  I suppose I should have known it is mainly for a crib considering the built in night light and lullaby sounds (that can be activated from the receiver).Nonetheless, it is still a very high quality product if used for crib monitoring purposes.  We will still use it for video only monitoring since the picture is so good.PROS:* Well built with high quality materials.  It doesn't feel cheap.* Built in infrared lights allow day or night video* Magnetic swivel base or swivel clamp mounting* Clean, clear video picture* Innovative belt clip swivels into a prop stand* Remotely activated lullabysCONS:* Audio threshold should be more sensitive to allow placement on dresser or nearby furniture.* Nightlight doesn't really put out light... only 'glowing stars'RECOMMENDATION:I would highly recommend this if your intent is to monitor your child in a crib.  I would not suggest it for placement across a room unless your only purpose is to have video.  If so, then it will work great.

Reviews.Title: Baby video monitor you must have!
Reviews.Author: morning fog
Reviews.Content: This is a great product! I loved it. I just received it a few days ago and I use it every day during my son's nap time. The video quality is not too bad, and the infrared mode is very useful in low-light settings. Since it is a wireless video monitor, its use is quite convenient. Also, this device, being wireless, does not interfere with other wireless devices, such as wifi home network, cordless/cell phone, and radio. The battery lasts for about 2 hours (not too bad). Also, this device is simple and easy to use!Pros: automatic infrared, brightness control, vox feature, magnetic camera stand, and built in nightlight in the camera.Cons/Improvements: Wish it had a regular rechargeable battery (it currently has a lithium ion battery). I also wish it had an audio only option, rather than just a video option (this could save some battery life). --Aside these suggestions, this device is great for any parent!

Reviews.Title: Pretty nice gadget!
Reviews.Author: Michael Countryman "mike the camera man"
Reviews.Content: These days we have all kinds of toys to spy on our little loved ones so we know there every move day or night. This is a nice tool for doing just that. They did not have these around for my other children so you had to get up and check on them. This is the stealth way of checking on them without waking them up.Now this is not the cheapest monitor on the market but does have many nice features. This is probably the simplest one to set up. It is truly a plug and play setup. I had mine going in less than 5 minutes.Pros:I really like the design of the belt clip for the monitor that also doubles as a stand when you rotate it. I am in the garage working on cars allot so I can have the monitor on my side at all times with the belt clip.You can use the VOX mode so that the camera only turns on when sound is heard or enough crying for that matter.The battery in the portable monitor is rechargeable and seems to last for many hours when I am using it unplugged.The music feature is also nice not too loud but would be nice to be able to adjust it.I really thought the pivot base for the camera is very well designed so that you can turn it up down and all around in any position.Negatives:Not really to  much not to like about it.The screen is low resolution but lets get real were not making HD films with it although it could be a little clearer.The screen frame rate it low so the movements are jerky but again were not making HD films with it.Night light is cute but that is about all it is.The manufacture states that it will work up to 150ft. I was able to use mine at about 80ft before the link signal started breaking up. No problem though since I am do not use it any further than that anyways.All in all I like it and it will get a lot of use.

Reviews.Title: Overall, pretty cool, but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Kaio
Reviews.Content: This thing is actually pretty cool.  Setup is easy - just pop in the supplied rechargeable battery into the handheld unit and plug it in to charge.  The handheld can be used while charging, or you can wait till it's fully charged.  I have mine on my desk and will probably use it while plugged into the adapter since I'm always here working anyway, but since it's plugged in, the battery will always be charged and ready to go.  There's a belt clip on the back that doubles as a kickstand to keep the unit standing upright on a desk or table.Next, pop 4AAA batteries into the camera (not incl.) or use it wired via a second power adapter.  As far as setup, that's really pretty much all you need to do.  Just turn on the camera and the handheld unit, and you're good to go.  The camera can also be mounted using the included hardware mount.The lullaby feature, nightlight and such, are all pretty self explanatory and easy to use.  The coolest feature being the lullaby - you can select different songs to play from the handheld unit, change songs and even hear them play on the handheld unit itself.  The lullabys don't play very loud on the camera itself, but I wouldn't expect them to.  The nightlight on the camera has nice little stars that glow a gentle yellow, though I wish it could be turned on and off via the handheld unit, same as the lullabys.  The VOX feature turns the handheld screen on if the camera senses tje baby crying or making loud noise, though I don't honestly see using that feature since I'd rather have the handheld screen on all the time, as opposed to just part of the time.  Kind of negates the whole point of this thing, so not a useful feature in my opinion.  The camera also switches automatically between daylight and night vision modes and the quality of the night vision is pretty good.  The handheld unit also has brightness controls to improve the picture if need be.I only have 3 complaints:1)  The power adapters suck.  It was smart to make both the same so there's no confusion, but they both have those big klunky shielding nubs on the end that plugs into the camera and handheld unit.  This might not sound like a big deal, but I promise you won't like it if you want to use the adapter as the power source for the camera or handheld unit.  That big nub makes it impossible to do a nice, clean and unobtrusive wiring job because you've got this 1" x 1.5" cylindrical nub just a few inches from where it plugs into the camera or handheld unit.  I was going to use the adapter on the camera, but that dumb nub looks ugly and there's no way to do a nice wiring job because of it.  All it takes is one seemingly insignificant little thing like that to ruin an otherwise nice product. Probably looked good on paper or was cost effective, but in a working environment, just a very bad idea and totally unnecessary.2)  I have a pet peeve with LED lights on electronics that are too bright for units meant to be used in the dark.  The camera has a large green indicator light that glows green when the batteries are good and/or the power adapter is plugged in and the unit is on.  The LED glows red when the batteries need to be changed.  In daylight, the LED is fine, but at 3AM it feels like a bright spotlight.  There should be a way to turn it off or dim it automatically when the night vision is activated.  It doesn't need to be so big either.  Or they could've positioned it on the back of the unit and made it smaller.  It's not like baby needs to know the status of the batteries.3) Lastly, I really wish they would've had a video out hookup on the handheld unit.  I'd like to have the option of hooking this up to a larger monitor so I can see better.  That, or since it's WiFi, it could've linked into the computer somehow.  Not totally necessary, but it would've been an impressive addition.Overall, I'd say this is a pretty good unit, though I think the price is a little steep.Good Luck! :)

Reviews.Title: Extremely useful device
Reviews.Author: Raven A. Wind
Reviews.Content: The BABYVIEW20 is a pretty straightforward device. You have a little camera/microphone that can either be mounted on a crib (or wherever) by a bracket, or sit on a magnetic plate and swivel around, and you have a receiver about the size of a 90s mobile phone that can tune in both sound and picture from the camera unit. Both work with either batteries or AC power adapter (included). The battery pack on the receiver is rechargeable, while the camera uses AA batteries and burns through those pretty quickly. You're better off using the AC adapter for the camera.The camera has night vision, which works pretty well. It also has a microphone, and can be set to turn on the receiver's screen if the sound in the room gets above a certain level (like, for instance, a baby crying). The camera also has the ability to play soothing music, which can be triggered from the receiver. If baby cries, the screen turns on, you hear the baby, and you can hit "play" and hopefully it puts baby back to sleep. Of course, your mileage may vary. The camera also has some star-shaped night-lights on it that can be turned on as an option.As a wireless camera, you can't ask for much more. My only regret is that I see no way to use it as as source for recording what you see on the screen. If you were thinking of using this as a security device once your baby outgrew the need, you'd find it rather limited.The receiver is intuitive, has a few basic controls and indicator lights, and has a nice stand on the back that can swivel around to become a belt clip.Video quality is that of a decent webcam. It's not anything you'd want to shoot video with, but then that's not the point. It lets you see what is happening a few rooms away, in the dark. Even if your baby sleeps through the night, this is sure to put worried parents at ease. You can check in without risking waking your baby by turning on lights or making noise in the room.Battery life, as stated, isn't so hot. If you turn the music or lights, the camera will burn through the four AA batteries in a couple hours. It's best to use the AC adapter, or just never use the music or night light feature if you intend to mount it somewhere away from an outlet and must rely on batteries. The receiver fares better. Using its own rechargeable battery pack helps, and the recharge time is only a few hours.The bottom line: This is a great baby monitor, but I wouldn't call it a home security device (despite some of the tags attached to it here on Amazon). It COULD be used for home security, but it would require you to monitor it in order to get any benefit, and if you're sleeping it's not going to be of much use in catching anyone. As a wireless surveillance device, however, it succeeds. I could see this being used in the kids' playroom or pointed at the back yard, so parents can keep an eye on the kids without being clinging to them all the time. Your kid gets a little more freedom, and you get peace of mind.

Reviews.Title: Good Wireless Monitor - Recommended
Reviews.Author: C. Hill "CFH"
Reviews.Content: The BABYVIEW20 was a pleasant surprise in it's ease of setup and overall quality. The set contains everything needed to get started, including:* Portable Monitor - About the size of a large cordless phone, with a decent video screen* Wireless Camera - About the size of a baseball* Two power supplies/chargers one each for the hand-held monitor (includes rechargeable battery) and wireless camera (4 AAA batteries can also be used, but are not included).* Two mounting systems are provided for the camera - including the sturdy tabletop base with built in magnet (to keep the camera stable) and a clamp crib mountThings we liked:* Great Range - Was able get good reception for the 1st floor of our old Victorian house all of the way to far corner of the third floor* VOX Mode - The sound activation mode works very well and will provides piece of mind that you will know when something needs your attention* Night Vision Mode - Automatic activation and good clarity make this a very useful feature for watching the scene when the lights are out* Monitor Clip - Rotates from belt clip to support stand, very handyThings we didn't like (hence the 4 out 5 stars):* Camera Size - This is a good sized device and could likely have been built a little smaller* Camera "Star Lights" - Not very useful at all, but fortunately can be turned offOverall this is a great wireless camera and monitor that works as advertised! As one other reviewer noted, this would have benefited from having a video out option so you could record from the monitor, but that would likely have raised the price.Recommended!CFH

Reviews.Title: Great Customer Service
Reviews.Author: ConnorsMommy
Reviews.Content: I ordered this as an Amazon Flash deal with Prime.  Arrived fast as usual and was very easy to set-up and use.  The first night the night vision wouldn't stay on and kept flashing back and forth between regular and night vision so I couldn't always see the video.  I called Levana and the customer service there was amazing!  After troubleshooting the unit they decided to send me a new one.  The new one arrived in a timely fashion and works great!  The reason that customer service is great is because they will call when it is most convenient for you (not during nap time) and will send out a new unit before the broken one is returned due to this being a baby monitor and it being necessary to have and use.The picture is not the best, but this also is not the top of the line monitor.  The picture is clear enough to see everything and works great.  I LOVE the VOX feature which turns the screen off unless the baby makes a noise (this model is a preset level that you can't change) and then it will turn on, great battery saving feature.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: Kervin Lucas
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent product for a "First-Time Parent"I am located in Costa Rica and I get this product in a very short time. I'm going to write my review in spanish for all the Latina that are interested in this product:Al principio tuve mis dudas sobre este articulo por algunos malos comentarios que lei pero al final me decidi, lo compre, y mi esposa y yo estamos satisfechos con este articulo.* Muy buena calidad de video,* Buena calidad de sonido,* Facil de instalar,* Practico diseño,El unico contra que tiene a mi parecer es que el monitor no viene con bateria recargable (se puede usar con 4 baterias 3A o con el adaptador de corriente)Pero en general "muy bien"

Reviews.Title: COLOMBIA -CALIFICIACION PRODUCTO
Reviews.Author: sergio martinez
Reviews.Content: Este equipo lo compre  por Amazon desde Colombia (Bogotá)Realmente había tenido algunas cámaras inalámbricas pero definitivamente es la mejor.De verdad, que la facilidad de prenderla, conecatrla y usarla es muy pero muy simple. EL alcance es excelente, he podido colocar la cámara en el cuarto del bebé y recorrer todo mi apartamento ( 120mts cuadrados) y la imagen es perfecta, no hay interferecnias de ningún tipo, el color es muy bueno, eso si, hay que colcoar la cámara muy cerca al bebé apra verlo bien, si se aleja mucho no se aprecian bien los detalles, pero se sigue viendo bien. El sonido es perfecto y se puede graduar, el botón que tiene para que la cámara solo e active cuando hay rudio es muy bueno, eso sireve para que el monitor no ilumine mucho nuestro cuarto cuando esta encendida, o sea, apretamos el boton, la camara queda oscura, cuando la bebé llora se enciende...excelente. Por otro lado, podemos desde nuestro monitor, oprimir un botón para que la cámara emita tes tipos de musica en la cámara de la bebé, o sea  desde nuestro cuarto seleccionamos la música y en la camara de ella suena..tono inalámbricamente.la camara no pesa mucho, y se puede portar en la correa del cinturón.La cámara viene con un soporte que se puede ajustar a cualquier tipo de cuna, corral, o cama.Sinceramente estoy feliz con este producto.SaludesSergio

Reviews.Title: cheap power hook-up
Reviews.Author: William T. Andrews Jr.
Reviews.Content: The baby monitor was great for the first month. After the first month the hand-held will not charge. The connection for the power chord is not made to last. You would figure that an item that costs a fair amount of money would work for longer. Maybe make a tad less profit and make a product that is a higher quality.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Purchase!
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Gerace
Reviews.Content: This product is very easy to set up, easy to use and gives me peace of mind knowing I can always see what my toddler is up to!

Reviews.Title: Great Video Monitor!!!
Reviews.Author: Sistasledge "Juliette's Mommy"
Reviews.Content: I  love this monitor!! It is by far the best thing I have bought and makes my life with my first baby so easy!! The picture is great, no interferance from truckers, cell phones, etc. Very portable, cute design and I love that you can turn the music on from another room if the baby gets fussy! My only complaints are ones that I can live with. I wish the volume on the music was adjustable and I wish the battery on the monitor would give you a beep or two to let you know when it is about to die on you. That's it! Nothing major. This makes it easy to go take a shower, hang out on the other side of the house and even go out in the yard. You can always see what your baby is up to! GREAT IDEA, GREAT PRODUCT!!!

Reviews.Title: Great product but didn't meet my needs
Reviews.Author: Dominique W
Reviews.Content: The Levana BABYVIEW20 Interference Free Digital Wireless baby monitor is an excellent product but it didn't fit my needs. My son moves around constantly in his sleep.  It was difficult for me to keep him in the camera's view during most of his nap. This left the device useless to me.We ended up rigging the camera to my oldest son's RC car and allowing him to use the device as a spy system.  He loves it!For younger babies this would be an awesome product. There is a nightlight for the baby to look at and night vision to make monitoring baby easier for mom and dad.  The camera can be mounted or set in the holder.  The receiver is indeed interference free.  I would love to have had this when my kids were smaller.  However, I have made good use of it.A positive aspect of this product is that it can be used for different purposes after the baby gets too old for it. I've read other reviews that listed different uses.  I was able to make my son a mobile spy unit with it.  Overall I believe that it is money well spent. I just didn't discover it in time for it to be used as advertised.  I would recommend this to others and would not hesitate on purchasing this as a baby shower gift for a close friend.I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 only because I was disappointed with the camera range on it.

Reviews.Title: good product

Reviews.Content: good product, , thank you, the sound i clear and the image is fine . just what i need, for my baby

Reviews.Title: Does the job, but has some minor issues (including a safety concern)
Reviews.Author: Jason E. Smith "Impatient Reader"
Reviews.Content: The Babyview is a reasonably good video monitor which gets the job done, but has some minor issues which detract from a five star rating.The GOOD:-Decent wireless range.  Expect about 90% coverage of a 2000sq ft. modern home.  Older homes might see 80%.-Decent video/picture quality which is easy to see and discern day or night.-The audio threshold which triggers the monitor to spontaneously turn on is perfectly tuned.  It comes on when baby is awake or thrashing and rarely activates for non-events.-The camera has a standard camera tripod mount, so that a clamp can be utilized to mount it securely onto a shelf or ledge.-Good battery, which holds a charge for many hours of mobile use.The BAD:-The 1.5" plastic tip covering the antenna on the display unit is easily pulled off the unit.  Our toddler used to routinely pull it off.  It's perfectly sized to be swallowed and to choke a toddler to death.  It bothers me.  We ended up taping it securely to the unit with ugly electrical tape.-Unfamiliar family members (and occasionally even myself) accidentally press the music button on the monitor unit which starts blasting bad music to sleeping baby.  I've considered removing that button entirely.  The music has never served any useful purpose (it does not lull baby to sleep) and should probably be removed from the product.-Wireless connection is sometimes interrupted by computer or smartphone wifi data activity, which triggers an annoying, loud "lost connection" beep.  During 30 minutes of heavy internet usage, this might happen ten times.WOULD I BUY THIS AGAIN?  Probably not.  I wouldn't return or replace this unit, but if I were starting over--I would investigate other options due to the minor issues listed above.  Also, the addition of an ambient temperature sensor (found on some competing products) is a worthwhile feature missing from this one.

Reviews.Title: Levana Babyview20
Reviews.Author: Barbara P Jones
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Levana Babyview20 as a gift for a baby shower.  The baby monitor has not been used yet, but I purchased this  brand based on some positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: GREAT GIFT. PROMPT SERVICE.

Reviews.Content: Giving the baby monitor as a shower gift.  The shipping was prompt and arrived as specified.  The monitor is well made and works in a two story home.  Love the video aspect so you can see as well as hear.

Reviews.Author: Tracy Lea Roberts "Lea"
Reviews.Content: The sound did not work on ours. I called the company but they could not solve the problem. The picture quality is okay... the large screen is a bonus. But, we actually purchased a 1st Years Clear View when this one here broke. The 1st years was much better - clean picture, zoom feature, and crisp sound plus the price on the 1st years was $30 less.  ;)

Reviews.Content: I purchased this product a 3 years ago and enjoyed it.  When I took it out of storage for my next baby the sound did not work.  There is no live customer service.  You have to do a live chat which took forever and at the end they told me it was out of warranty so they couldn't help me. Reviews.Author: Lauren Elizabeth Tarczali
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace the Levana ClearVu Digital Video Monitor I had inherited from a friend that ended up fizzling out after 3 years. The product looked very similar and was a decent price compared to other video monitors.When it arrived, I was surprised at how large the camera was. Also, it had a magnetic base that had limited rotation, so I wasn't able to angle it to get a good view of the baby in the crib from a dresser or any other table-top location. Unlike the Levana ClearVu, it did not come with a wall mount either. I tried to program the existing Levana camera I had to work with this monitor, but it would not work. Therefore, I had to return it and repurchase the original model I had.

Reviews.Title: Excelent baby monitor!
Reviews.Author: J.Belden
Reviews.Content: We have tried several baby monitors.  BABYVIEW20, although not the newest from Levana now, is still our favorite due to its simple operation and very practical product design features like:1) We love VOX, and the fact that BABYVIEW20 takes only 15 seconds to turn off the screen.  Others take up to 3 minutes which is way too much!2) The monitor is SILENT, no hissing sounds... only if needed (the baby speaks, cries) would you actually hear a thing3) Hanging option, not only tabletop (although our second BABYVIEW20 ONLY CAME with the circular base)4) The screen resolution is ok, fluid, etc.5) We have seen better ranges, but still fine here.Hope you find this review helpful!

Reviews.Title: Not worth the $ - sensor never worked, monitor completely stopped working after 6 months
Reviews.Author: Denise Downey
Reviews.Content: We got this as a baby shower gift and have had problems since day 1. First, the noise sensor doesn't work so well. The monitor will turn on if a car drives by, however, my baby could be screaming and it won't click on. We attempted to work with Levana to get it replaced, but they wanted us to mail it back to them while they looked at it before they could replace it (thus leaving us without a baby monitor for at least a week). We decided just to deal with it and keep the baby monitor "on" instead of in "vex mode" (sensor mode). Well, after 6 months of use, this monitor has officially stopped working completely. We will attempt to work with Levana again to get it replaced, but I am not too excited about dealing with this company again.

Reviews.Author: onestopnyc
Reviews.Content: It was very easy to set up and the quality of the picture was surprisingly good. Like the night vision feature, the night light and the fact that you can easily direct the camera in any direction because of it's form. Belt clip is a smart addition. Reviews.Title: Nice Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Sarwat Ezzeldin "PrinceAly"
Reviews.Content: This is a very practical baby monitor, easy to set-up and easy to use. The wireless camera (the size of a baseball) can be powered by 4 AA batteries (not included) or with the supplied power adapter, the portable wireless monitor with 2" color screen is powered by rechargeable batteries and can also be powered by the supplied power adapter; its clip can double as a stand to put the monitor on flat surface. There are two options to mount the camera, either on a flat surface using the magnetic base, or by using the clamp to attach directly to the baby's crib. The camera can be adjusted in any direction with the mounting ball joint.  The camera has a built-in switched night light, it is also equipped with automatically activated night vision for use when it gets dark. The camera also can play a selection of lullabies that can be remotely controlled from the monitor. The monitor can be turned off while you are sleeping, it will turn on automatically if the baby cries or make noise.The picture is jittery and the quality is marginal, so is the sound quality; however, it is not bad for the intended purpose. I placed the camera in the bedroom upstairs and the monitor downstairs, moved around the house carrying the monitor, the reception did not suffer, there was no interference near a working TV, cordless and cell phones.  Closing the bedroom door did not affect the reception.

Reviews.Title: Nice Design
Reviews.Author: R2
Reviews.Content: The baby monitor is definitely well designed.  The only drawback for me was that the digital video ended up being a little "blocky" when the signal wasn't as good as apposed to an analog viewer that just gets a little fuzzy.Benefits:-The belt clip on the handset rotates so that it props up the handset if placed on a table.-Music played by the video camera can be triggered by the handset (cool feature, although, we'll probably never use it).-The camera can be rotated easily because of the circular design-Lights can be turned on as a nightlight-Sound is broadcast when it's made,Disadvantages:-Didn't like the "blocky" digital video when the reception wasn't so good.-The colors displayed were okay, not great.

Reviews.Author: J. Rodriguez "JROD"
Reviews.Content: This monitor is perfect for a first time mom.  I am always so paranoid about not having my baby sleeping in my room right by my side, but now I can sleep tight.  My 2 month old is already in his own room because of this monitor.  The image is so clear and so is the audio.  There is absolutely no interferance and the image is perfectly clear in the day and night.  It is worth the extra money knowing my baby is safe.

Reviews.Title: 4.5 Stars Very Handy Device That Can Be Used For A Variety of Things
Reviews.Author: FirePepper Red "firepepper red"
Reviews.Content: The Levana Babyview20 seems pretty pricey at first until you actually use it.  It has a number of innovative and useful features which make this monitor well worth price.*** Initial Impressions:***The Unit is well made and seems to be made to withstand minor drops or bumps.  The handheld unit is reasonably sized and the screen is the right balance of being large enough to see clearly yet small enough to make the receiver portable.  There is a clip on the back of the reciever which can be used to mount the handheld unit to your belt or swivel it around to use as a desktop stand. The clip is the only part of the unit that seems a bit fragile.Another big plus is that both the receiver and the camera can be used with batteries.  The camera can use 4 AAA batteries (not included) and the receiver uses a replaceable lithium battery which means that this device is truely portable and if the battery ever wears down you simply replace it with a new one or use the ac adapter.*** Setup: ***Setup is very easy.  Simply plug in the adapters and turn on the monitor and instantly you have a picture and audio of whatever the camera is pointing at.  The receiver unit has buttons on the side to control the contrast of the LCD screen as well as a volume/on off slider.  The other side has buttons which turn the music on and off on the camera, as well as change songs.  The front has small lights that tell you when each of the functions is on and it has multiple LED lights to show you the sound levels in case you keep the volume turned down.  The camera comes with a crib mount and also a stand to place it on a flat surface like a desk or dresser.*** Picture Quality: ***The small screen makes for a small picture and it is about medium resolution but it is definitely good quality. I found no interference at all from other appliances or from Wifi or cell phones. Unfortunately the video is less than 30 frames a second (probably more like 20-25) which means that motion is not fluid.  This is not really a big deal since this is a monitor and not a video camera!  The range is very good and works all over my house even on mulitple floors.  One thing that sets this monitor apart from the rest is that it has a an automatic night vision feature.  The camera automatically senses when it is dark and it switches on 9 infrared LEDs so that it can see in total darkness.  This means you can see your baby perfectly when the lights are out.*** Other Uses: ***Though this is marketed as a baby monitor it can be used for a number of other things.  You can place the camera near a front window and be able to see who is at the front door without having to get up (or come downstairs).  You can also use this as a makeshift security monitor.  I have also found this helpful for being able to see in tight and cramped situations like under a kitchen sink (to check for leaks) or to peek into a cramped attic. My wife even suggested that this would make a handy improvised backup camera for a large SUV.  The possibilities are endless!*** Positive Points Include: ***- Compact size- Good quality video- Video is a secure connection so others will not be able to view your home.- Easy Setup and has multiple uses- Works with AC adpaters or batteries so it truely portable- User replaceable batteries so you don't need to discard it once the batteries lose charge- Lots of features like night lights and sounds*** Negative Points Include: ***- Video framerate is less than 30fps so video is a bit jerky but its very good for its intended purpose.- Swivel clip on the back of the receiver seems a bit delicate- The camera portion is a bit large and could be smaller.- No video output so no chance of recording video (then again thats not what this is made for!)Overall the Levana Babyview20 is very good and well worth its price when you consider the multiple uses that can be found for it. I took off half a star because of the low frame rate and the rather large size of the camera.  Other than that this is one of the better video monitors on the market.
